body.rich:
Nokia 2018 Mandatory Training officially launched!

Please take time to complete them and QD TC CoDE will track the status.

attachments.title: Nokia 2018 Mandatory Training officially launched!
attachments.content_excerpt:
As of 25/05/18 Nokia 2018 Mandatory Training is officially launched under this Learning Store address (https://learningstore.nokia.com/employee/#?item=n.1468579212114).
The training curriculum Mandatory Training 2018 | SMAABOG-K-1804 includes the following courses:

- We Respect Privacy (now available)
- Nokia Code of Conduct Commitment to Business Integrity (coming in June)
Note that Mandatory Training is training that all Nokia internal, permanent employees (including managers) must complete to enable them to carry out their work tasks. Mandatory training may be limited to a group or particular function of employees, or it may mean Nokia-wide, crucial training in order to help ensure:

1. Company-wide implementation of a new process or practice
2. Enforcement of a company-wide existing process or practice, way of conduct etc.
3. Company-wide competence requirement
Learning Index-related note:As far as Learning Index is concerned the Mandatory Training curriculum is prioritized at Nokia level (visible in My Team Priority for all organizations which are part of the Learning Index program) which means the points for completing it will be counted accordingly in your Learning Index scoring.

For more information about Mandatory Training please review read the Mandatory Training Q&A. (https://wam.inside.nsn.com/redirect/redirect.asp?target=HTTPS%3A%2F%2Fsharenet%2D%2Dims%2Eint%2Enet%2Enokia%2Ecom%2Fllauth%2Flivelink%3Ffunc%3Drshimsiam%2Eiamlogin%26CurrentClientTime%3D%26NextURL%3D%2D%2Flivelink%2D%2Flivelink%2D%2FOpen%2D%2FD553600459)

cc: Swistak, Katarzyna (Nokia - PL/Warsaw), Zonza, Michele (Nokia - IT/Vimercate), Stakias, Pantelis (Nokia - GR/Athens)

attachments.content_excerpt:
CI is a very hot topic in DevOps, in MN, each product or even each team has its own CI infrastructure and solution and there’s commercial product to provide CI framework (most famous is Jenkins). But what's the best one for you? Can we MN have a common solution?

This Thursday, we will invite Fu Minjie from 4G RAN L2 to share their CI boost initiatives, how can they increase the promotion frequency doubled? How can they shorten the branch time from 2 weeks to <10 mins? Can it be used by others without big migration effort and risk?

Please check out the attached invitation, share with your colleagues and join the webex event, let's discuss then.

body.plain:

This Thursday, we will invite Fu Minjie from 4G RAN L2 to share their CI boost initiatives, how can they increase the promotion frequency doubled? How can they shorten the branch time from 2 weeks to <10 mins? Can it be used by others without big migration effort and risk?

Please check out the attached invitation, share with your colleagues and join the webex event, let's discuss then.

body.parsed:
2018 Q2 Qingdao LD Activity Volunteer Award 

There are 4 activity volunteers recognized as good volunteers in their project with best award by Qingdao TC office in Q2.
They have good engagement and great contribution in their project, which brought us enjoyable and impressive activities.
Below are the 4 winners’ good stories.

1.	Happy Mu from Happy Job Team ---Fun Sports Meeting
Happy Mu has been the enthusiastic chairperson for Happy Job Team for several years. Happy has been leading and influencing the team in many positive ways, like being passionate, creative and devoted etc. With those Characteristics, HjT has contributed to many big and meaningful events for the TC/site, e.g. 1st Hackathon, annual Anniversary Celebration, Team-building activities, Company dance and TC/site videos etc. Happy has been a role model in terms of young leader helping the entire TC/site create happy environment and great global image.

2.	Sunny Bi from ELT ---Weekly English Tips and Culture Shock
    Sunny Bi serves in ELT team for several years and take the chairman role from 2017 during ELT team reorganization. Sunny takes great initiative and demonstrates very good ownership to lead ELT team on kinds of activities to support the overall R&D English learning promotion and English learning mindset building up with lots of overtime/extra effort. He works together with ELT team to prepare the weekly English Tips and share with R&D every week persistently at Q1/Q2 of 2018. He leads ELT to coordinate the culture shock of Belgium at the May. 2018 with extra effort to prepare/setup the poster, advocate the activity, prepare the logistic like demo center decoration, discuss detail plan with presenter..etc  and got good feedback from audiences. 

3.	Tristan Yu from Innovation --- Machine Learning
Tristan Yu did below brilliant work to bring Innovation Community to QD in half year:
Setup Machine Learning study group in QD.
Promotion, careful preparation, design the team structure and working flow, 30+ individuals joined the study group.
Hosted 8 sessions of group study, and connected Professor in Ocean University for ML training/collaborations.
4.	Lyne Chu from WLN – 2018 Girls in ICT Day
Lyne Chu led the WLN team preparing on every details by connecting with two local university. On the afternoon of April 20, 2018, Nokia Qingdao Center and QINGDAO University joined hands and carried out the "Girls in ICT Day" activity, and gained very good feedback from other students and many of them shared the vision of being a member of innovation and contribute their talents in ICT industry after graduate. “Girls in ICT Day” is an annual activities of Qingdao Nokia WLN Team which aimed to encourage female students to join the industry of information and communication technology. Thanks Lyne for her great effort to coordinated  the “Girls in ICT Day” activity for year 2017 and 2018. 
 
Thanks for their contribution in Q2 LD activities again!
QD TC Office

body.rich: Qingdao has  8 SPC (SAFe Program Consultant) to be certified to support SAFe transformation and deployment. Looking forward to the first train launched from Qingdao.

attachments.content_excerpt:
SAFe SPC training in TC Beijing

Last week, SAFe SPC training was conducted in TC Beijing, thought maybe the one of the latest session within MN, but definitely most learning spirits and take-aways.

It was kicked of by Head of TC Beijing Liu Hailing with full encouragement and expectations, as well as firm belief that participants will not only equip themselves but also will lead MN SAFe into next level. The kick-off was followed by MN SAFe introduction by Tony Song which further ignited the learning enthusiasm on how to adapt SAFe successfully within own working context during and after the 4 days. Wang Ying from MN SAFe central LACE also gave some latest MN SAFe deployment update and answered hot questions.

SAFe is a freely available knowledge base of proven, integrated principles and practices for Lean, Agile and DevOps, the Core Value of SAFe are Built-in Quality, Program Execution, Alignment and Transparency.

Andrew Sales and Frederick Victor, two experienced and stimulating SPCTs make the training meaningful, boosted the thinking, discussion, simulations into fervour about how to lead SAFe (2day) and how to implement SAFe (2day). 29 learners from both Beijing and Qingdao have questioned, shared, discussed, debated and ultimately learned many topics during the course, every day from 8:30 to almost 18:00 from Tuesday thru Friday. Mindful pictures and drawings were put up on all the three walls, even pillars in the middle.

After parcipants pass the Exam and enablement, they will deliver all role-based training in the TCs including Leading SAFe to leaders, managers, SAFe for POPM, SAFe for Scrum Master, SAFe for Teams etc.

Training was done, but learning does not, it continues,
Be Agile, Scale up, Stay lean, Stay SAFe, too

cc: Liu, Hailing (NSB - CN/Beijing), Zhao, Grace J. (Nokia - CN/Qingdao), Xia, Jane (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Chen, Yongping (NSB - CN/Beijing), Ma, Linsheng (NSB - CN/Beijing)

body.parsed: CTS API team won the Business Excellence Award (BEA).
body.plain: CTS API team won the Business Excellence Award (BEA).(1 Share attached)
body.rich: CTS API team won the Business Excellence Award (BEA).

attachments.content_excerpt:
I’d like to share the great news that 3 sets of individuals and teams from our TAS R&D Tribe recently won the Business Excellence Award (BEA). The BEA recognizes significant achievements in Quality, Leadership, Productivity & Profitability. To be an award recipient, the impacts must be sustainable and measurable.

Matina Tsavli and the Security Audit Team took the initiative to create the NTAS Security Hardening Process and an automated tool to check the Security Hardening Checklist. This has allowed security audit testing to run on a branch basis, finding, reporting and enabling the fixing of all new vulnerabilities before merging new code into the release branch – a great example of left shift. Matina is recognized for her strong initiative and passion for excellence and quality. https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/#/Threads/show?threadId=987987870

The PlaTo tool was invented to give answer for a long pending question: how to simplify the deployment planning of complicated core products with hight precision. Greg Mate and his team gave an answer for this problem, and reduced core product planning time by a factor of 10. The tool is praised by peer organizations and is creating value for Nokia already. Greg is recognized for his broad vision, innovation and strong focus on customer needs.
https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=12153859

The CTS API team has demonstrated a strong track record of delivering TAS Call Management API’s, generating several million Euros in revenue, and recently going beyond their call of duty to develop a PoC demo of TAS API-based Digital Assistant application for Vz, leading to capturing new business for Innovation Gateway solution, and potentially opening the door for NTAS opportunities. The team is recognized for their customer-first mindset and for laying a solid API foundation upon which many business offering have been built. Team members: Hank Liu, Alex Wang, Patrick Zhou, Kevin Song, John Xiao, William Cao, Steven Niu, Li Zhang, Henry Wang, E-Ling Lou, Simon Ou, Jeff Bantly.
https://nokia-my.sharepoint.com/:p:/g/personal/michael_bian_nokia-sbell_com/EWiBgi8Gs-VEp-Mrs6HOl5MByaoelk2b4H23wUkZEy-c_w?e=Q0feVv

Congratulations to all award recipients for their outstanding initiative and business impacts.

body.parsed:
Welcome to International Conference on Virtual Reality and Visualization
(China VR 2018 & ICVRV 2018)

The joint Conference of the 8th International Conference on Visual Reality and Visualization (ICVRV 2018) and the 18th China Conference on Virtua Reality (China VR 2018) will be held in Qingdao, China, from October 22nd to 24th, 2018.
ICVRV & China VR 2018 seeks original, high-quality papers in all area related to Virtual Reality (VR), Augmented Reality (AR) and Mix Reality (MR).
We invite submissions of new ideas, and encourage all forms of research creativity and originality. We are interested in theoretical and technological innovations, novel applications, practice and experience analysis, and we hope to establish standard in this field and stimulate future trends.

If you are interested in it, please register via below link:
http://www.icvrv.org/

For more details, please review attached pictures.

body.parsed:
All，

The Qingdao G1HB team has launched the G1HB propaganda event to drive us to think and build new ways of working successfully on 6/13(Main Building) and 6/14(R&D Center).Thanks to 375 employees from R&D,IT,HR,WR,FIN who joined the activities and contributed their thoughts and recognitions through conducting the questionnaire via their smart phones with a memorable gift received afterwards.

Here we would like to show the survey result and pictures:

Office365---Promote the Sharepoint tools to optimize the working experience. About 87.73% participants accepted the O365 and would like to use it on work to improve the working environment and efficiency.
Build the day--- Module focus on finding more techniques for time saving. More than 19.73% participants got know the related skills and 97.33% would like to learn more in future.
Meeting efficiency--- Purpose is to improve the meeting experience and take the steps towards more meaningful meetings. 29.87% recognized this program and 96.53% acknowledged that more than 10 minutes they saved during the meeting.

This is an activities to LEARN more G1HB skills, IMPROVE the productivity and MAKE the life more meaningful. Thanks to take the first step to win 1 hour back and enjoy the efficient working day @Nokia!

Many thanks,
Nokia Qingdao GH1B Core Team (Ellen Li, Leta Du, Crystal Xie, Dick Cao, Richard Wang, Henry Gao, Paula Li)
Mailto: qd-g1hb@LIST.NOKIA.COM

cc: [[user:1639993032]], [[user:1610777031]], [[user:1644031393]], [[user:1642077954]], [[user:1640333800]]

body.parsed:
2018 QD R&D Spring Fun Sports Game 
The weather becomes warmer and warmer, it is very suitable to do some sports. As a traditional event, 2018 QD R&D Spring Fun Sports Game was produced by Happy Job team. Total 27 teams joined this sports festival, from 4th to 12th of June 2018 during lunch break. Competition event was the relay race of filling cup by passing water, going through hula hoop, and skipping rope.
Fun Sports Game provided a good opportunity for us to go outside and do some exercise. Both players and non-players took an active part during the preparation and competition. After a fierce rivalry, 老虎外出我是王 (FN), COM天团 (COM) and 八仙过海 (SBC) won the first, the second and the third prize.
Happy Job Team aims to bring joy, strengthen team work and build healthier environment. Regardless of the result, we hope everyone enjoyed the game and get refreshed for better work!

attachments.content_excerpt:
Sharing some of my understanding on Dare

- Decisive and pace: Tribe and Squad leaders take the courage to make decisions in line with our aligned objectives, strategies and priorities
- Ambitious and keep learning: purse ambitious goals even when some time they appear to be out-of-reach or difficult to do
- Speaking Up: speak up and dare to challenge with respect when you feel something is wrong, do not let hierarchy define us
- Inspiring and Inclusive: dare to inspire teams and encourage different ideas, styles and perspectives

body.parsed:
The first official Lego4DevOps activity was held successfully in NewCenter of Qingdao Site on the 8th of June. 7 colleagues from different departments joined this game and all of them got a clear DevOps culture from this practice even for some participants who are not familiar with DevOps. As one participant said, it is much better to take practice than training. The game is really a good demo for DevOps culture. Thanks for all the participants: Li Lerro, Shi Erin, Sun Sarah, Zhang Sally, Gao Kerry, Gao Candy, Yang Edward.
Let us move to the second official practice. The game does not require any knowledge of DevOps nor is any specific role demanded. Also, the players do not need to be from the same team. If you want to join(You are welcome whether in NewCenter or KuTao), you can send an email to Aaron Liu(aaron.a.liu@nokia-sbell.com) or Summer Zhang(yaxing.zhang@nokia-sbell.com). Thanks.

body.rich:
The first official Lego4DevOps activity was held successfully in NewCenter of Qingdao Site on the 8th of June. 7 colleagues from different departments joined this game and all of them got a clear DevOps culture from this practice even for some participants who are not familiar with DevOps. As one participant said, it is much better to take practice than training. The game is really a good demo for DevOps culture. Thanks for all the participants: Li Lerro, Shi Erin, Sun Sarah, Zhang Sally, Gao Kerry, Gao Candy, Yang Edward.
Let us move to the second official practice. The game does not require any knowledge of DevOps nor is any specific role demanded. Also, the players do not need to be from the same team. If you want to join(You are welcome whether in NewCenter or KuTao), you can send an email to Aaron Liu(aaron.a.liu@nokia-sbell.com) or Summer Zhang(yaxing.zhang@nokia-sbell.com). Thanks.

messages.title: Qingdao TC – Newsletter May 2018

body.parsed:
Machine Learning @ Qingdao TC 

On May 25th, the first training session of Machine Learning is held by innovation team successfully. There are 30+ engineers attended this training. 

Innovation team invited professor Zhong Guoqiang from Ocean University who is very known expert in Data Mining and Deep Learning areas. Professor Zhong delivered a wonderful classroom training. He shared the history of Machine Learning, theory of Machine Learning and also some real user cases for using Machine Learning. Everyone are actively engaged and had a lot of interaction with professor Zhong. 

After the training, we had a hot discussion with professor Zhong how we can use Machine Learning in our products, like test cases generation, HW failure detection, etc., and professor Zhong gave us lots of useful feedback.

The next session is planned in the end of June. It will focus on a real Machine Learning case and its development lifecycle.

body.parsed:
Culture Shock--Belgium Culture Journey

On 29th May, the 2018 Culture Shock was held by ELT (English Learning Team) in Qingdao New center successfully.
The Culture Shock is a series of activities planned by Qingdao ELT which aims to improve the communication of Nokia staffs from different sites. ELT helps Qingdao R&D to understand the different styles on living, working and culture by inviting colleagues from Nokia global, to share their great ideas on those topics. At the same time, a good atmosphere of communication spreads around us. It is really a good chance to communicate with colleagues from different sites face to face! Everyone is encouraged to join and enjoy!
Culture Shock Silicon Belgium sharing is the second topic of this series. This time, ELT invited Wim De Smet, who was born in Ghent, Belgium and currently works as an R&D Engineer and expert on the Fixed Networks Cable line of products. Wim expressed his pleasure to share the history, culture and life of Belgium.
Wim gave a very expressing sharing about the Belgium, he shared the history, comic books, music, food, school system, sports, weather, transport and some famous cities of Belgium. NOKIA colleagues communicated with Wim and asked a lot of questions, and they felt very excited when they tasted the delicious Belgium biscuits and chocolate. Everyone felt well in Wim’s impassioned sharing. It is indeed an awesome sharing!

attachments.title: Nokia 2018 Mandatory Training officially launched!
attachments.content_excerpt:
As of 25/05/18 Nokia 2018 Mandatory Training is officially launched under this Learning Store address (https://learningstore.nokia.com/employee/#?item=n.1468579212114).
The training curriculum Mandatory Training 2018 | SMAABOG-K-1804 includes the following courses:

- We Respect Privacy (now available)
- Nokia Code of Conduct Commitment to Business Integrity (coming in June)
Note that Mandatory Training is training that all Nokia internal, permanent employees (including managers) must complete to enable them to carry out their work tasks. Mandatory training may be limited to a group or particular function of employees, or it may mean Nokia-wide, crucial training in order to help ensure:

1. Company-wide implementation of a new process or practice
2. Enforcement of a company-wide existing process or practice, way of conduct etc.
3. Company-wide competence requirement
Learning Index-related note:As far as Learning Index is concerned the Mandatory Training curriculum is prioritized at Nokia level (visible in My Team Priority for all organizations which are part of the Learning Index program) which means the points for completing it will be counted accordingly in your Learning Index scoring.

For more information about Mandatory Training please review read the Mandatory Training Q&A. (https://wam.inside.nsn.com/redirect/redirect.asp?target=HTTPS%3A%2F%2Fsharenet%2D%2Dims%2Eint%2Enet%2Enokia%2Ecom%2Fllauth%2Flivelink%3Ffunc%3Drshimsiam%2Eiamlogin%26CurrentClientTime%3D%26NextURL%3D%2D%2Flivelink%2D%2Flivelink%2D%2FOpen%2D%2FD553600459)

cc: Swistak, Katarzyna (Nokia - PL/Warsaw), Zonza, Michele (Nokia - IT/Vimercate), Stakias, Pantelis (Nokia - GR/Athens)

attachments.content_excerpt:
Adolfo and I visited the HetRAN 2G&3G team in Qingdao on Thursday this week. While it was a short visit, we did pack in a review of the GSM-A, Femto, and Cloud Core programs, met with MN TC Head and MN Tribe Leaders, held a skip level meeting and Adolfo presented a townhall with the GSM-A and CDMA-A (HCL) teams. As always, we were impressed with the engagement, passion, and amazing creativity of the GSM-A team as they showed us videos and a live “puppet” show. What fun, thanks!

Continuing the theme of having cake, we had one celebrating the start of a new journey for the GSM-A team working on Femto, along with some freshly picked cherries.

Slides are posted on the HetRAN DU site. Feel free to send any further questions on Yammer!

https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/hetran_team_site/SitePages/Home.aspx?RootFolder=%2Fsites%2Fhetran%5Fteam%5Fsite%2FPublic%20documents%2FHetRAN%20Townhalls%2FQ2%202018&FolderCTID=0x012000D2FF6F9CFEEACA4293D7AF7A972A9956&View=%7B0AD1FE04%2DDDC8%2D482F%2D97CB%2D1EC322C092AF%7D

body.parsed:
QD MSS&MGW R&D 9381 SGS-IWF Team Awarded “2018 Innovation Team” by QD Laoshan District Labor Union

QD MSS&MGW R&D 9381 SGS-IWF Team actively responded to Company, Laoshan district and Qingdao municipal government labor union calls to carry out staff technical innovation contests. According to Company strategy and product planning, team started next-generation machine type communication (MTC) platform product development from May 2015. Team members worked overtime to overcome many difficulties such as tight schedules, heavy tasks, and big challenges, and successfully completed the development and PoC of the FastTrack MTC platform product on VMM-HI – a new machine type communication product for Nokia Alcatel-Lucent Qingdao R&D Center. The team continued to develop and improve according to new demands put forward by customers, at the end of 2016 and in early 2017, it completed development of the first and second releases of another MTC product – SGS Interworking Function product on OpenStack cloud, and they were commercially deployed in Verizon's network in the US.

The product developed by the team is based on virtualization and cloud at the forefront of technology and that is an important platform for wireless communications to transform to 5G and IoT. The product can be widely used in systems such as intelligent transportation and smart cities. By mid-2017, the delivered versions have brought about considerable revenue of more than 10 million Euros to the company. In 2018, the contract value is expected to reach over 13 million Euros. At the same time, the team members also actively participated in activities such as product tools development and company rationalization proposals and Lean 6 Sigma, which saved more than 480 kilo Euros in expenses for the company.

1. Endeavor to Challenges – Completed Product Development and Commercialization in 8 Months

In the context of the urgent business needs from customer and the continuous addition of new features and shortened delivery dates, team members have overcome many difficulties, worked overtime, gave up many breaks and vacation time, worked very hard to finish committed work for each task. Some engineers even worked overtime after 12 o'clock in the evening for several weeks to safeguard delivery. The team finally completed the development of the new IoT products within 8 months and successfully implemented commercial deployment. And the high quality of the product was fully recognized by our US customer.

2. Pursuing Excellence - Leading in Cloud Product Technology 

During the implementation of the project, team members gathered wisdom, did not blindly stick to existing rules, and dared to innovate. On technical side, the wireless IoT communication platform products implement a virtual network function (VNF) deployment scheme that complies with the ETSI NFV standards. The solution is based on OpenStack, the industry's most popular open source cloud platform, and integrates Nokia's advanced VNF management platform to provide a complete solution for the deployment and lifecycle management of this product on the cloud platform. Team members participated in the architectural design and evolution of the cloud platform to have enabled the product to successfully use the existing SGS interface between LTE and the 3G core network to implement a convenient MTC access method on cloud.

The team focused on the frontiers and trends of technology development, and proposed the separation of wireless MTC communication bearer and signaling based on current product implementation. The new product have many features such as large capacity, can serve multiple service devices, and easily expandable on cloud platform, etc. When it comes to the lack of testing tools and lack of purchasing funds, it will affect the project schedule. The team members did not wait and developed their own test tools and surrounding NE simulators. This endeavor not only ensured schedule of the project, but also saved the company 380 kilo Euros in expenditure. In general, innovation is reflected in all aspects of product design, development and testing to ensure the successful completion of the project. Team members also successfully submitted several Chinese and international patents that have been applied to the realization of the product.

3. Sincere Cooperation - A Bright Future of Product 

The team have a reasonable structure and clear division of labor. There are consultant engineers with rich system architecture design experience, and young engineers who have just joined Nokia. Two of them are also leaders from company's innovation team. The team members fulfill their responsibilities, unite, and cooperate with each other in product solutions definition, development and testing, laboratory building, end-to-end solutions, and interoperability testing to promote the rapid progress of the project that demonstrated great teamwork and problem solving skills. The market prospect of the product is also very broad. Currently, we have received more than 10 million Euros from Verizon. And in 2018, the contract value is expected to reach over 13 million Euros.

4. Team's Excellent Results Won Many Recognition and Awards

•	2015 ASB WRLS China “Outstanding Innovation Award”
•	2015 Lucent QD “Golden Idea Contest” 1st Prize
•	2016 Laoshan District “Labor Pioneer Team”
•	2016 WLSRD H1 “Best Innovation Award”
•	2016 Laoshan District “Staff Outstanding Innovation Result”
•	2016 Lucent QD“Outstanding Team – Time to Market”
•	2017 Qingdao City “Innovation Team Award”

It is this spirit of hard work, solidarity and technological innovation of the 9381 SGS-IWF team that ensures the timely deliveries of the product to our customer, and with quality. This also lays a solid foundation for future product evolution and promotion. The team's outstanding performance and achievements have been unanimously approved by company leaders and colleagues. The team members will continue to work hard to contribute more to the company innovation activities.

And this honor is shared with our IH colleagues and platform team, their guidance and support of the 9381 product is key to the successful deliveries. This honor is also shared with all kinds of help/support received from other products/teams!

The product can be widely used in systems such as intelligent transportation and smart cities. By mid-2017, the delivered versions have brought about considerable revenue of more than 10 million Euros to the company. In 2018, the contract value is expected to reach over 13 million Euros. At the same time, the team members also actively participated in activities such as product tools development and company rationalization proposals and Lean 6 Sigma, which saved more than 480 kilo Euros in expenses for the company.

1. Endeavor to Challenges – Completed Product Development and Commercialization in 8 Months

In the context of the urgent business needs from customer and the continuous addition of new features and shortened delivery dates, team members have overcome many difficulties, worked overtime, gave up many breaks and vacation time, worked very hard to finish committed work for each task. Some engineers even worked overtime after 12 o'clock in the evening for several weeks to safeguard delivery. The team finally completed the development of the new IoT products within 8 months and successfully implemented commercial deployment. And the high quality of the product was fully recognized by our US customer.

2. Pursuing Excellence - Leading in Cloud Product Technology

During the implementation of the project, team members gathered wisdom, did not blindly stick to existing rules, and dared to innovate. On technical side, the wireless IoT communication platform products implement a virtual network function (VNF) deployment scheme that complies with the ETSI NFV standards. The solution is based on OpenStack, the industry's most popular open source cloud platform, and integrates Nokia's advanced VNF management platform to provide a complete solution for the deployment and lifecycle management of this product on the cloud platform. Team members participated in the architectural design and evolution of the cloud platform to have enabled the product to successfully use the existing SGS interface between LTE and the 3G core network to implement a convenient MTC access method on cloud.

The team focused on the frontiers and trends of technology development, and proposed the separation of wireless MTC communication bearer and signaling based on current product implementation. The new product have many features such as large capacity, can serve multiple service devices, and easily expandable on cloud platform, etc. When it comes to the lack of testing tools and lack of purchasing funds, it will affect the project schedule. The team members did not wait and developed their own test tools and surrounding NE simulators. This endeavor not only ensured schedule of the project, but also saved the company 380 kilo Euros in expenditure. In general, innovation is reflected in all aspects of product design, development and testing to ensure the successful completion of the project. Team members also successfully submitted several Chinese and international patents that have been applied to the realization of the product.

3. Sincere Cooperation - A Bright Future of Product

The team have a reasonable structure and clear division of labor. There are consultant engineers with rich system architecture design experience, and young engineers who have just joined Nokia. Two of them are also leaders from company's innovation team. The team members fulfill their responsibilities, unite, and cooperate with each other in product solutions definition, development and testing, laboratory building, end-to-end solutions, and interoperability testing to promote the rapid progress of the project that demonstrated great teamwork and problem solving skills. The market prospect of the product is also very broad. Currently, we have received more than 10 million Euros from Verizon. And in 2018, the contract value is expected to reach over 13 million Euros.

4. Team's Excellent Results Won Many Recognition and Awards

• 2015 ASB WRLS China “Outstanding Innovation Award”
• 2015 Lucent QD “Golden Idea Contest” 1st Prize
• 2016 Laoshan District “Labor Pioneer Team”
• 2016 WLSRD H1 “Best Innovation Award”
• 2016 Laoshan District “Staff Outstanding Innovation Result”
• 2016 Lucent QD“Outstanding Team – Time to Market”
• 2017 Qingdao City “Innovation Team Award”

It is this spirit of hard work, solidarity and technological innovation of the 9381 SGS-IWF team that ensures the timely deliveries of the product to our customer, and with quality. This also lays a solid foundation for future product evolution and promotion. The team's outstanding performance and achievements have been unanimously approved by company leaders and colleagues. The team members will continue to work hard to contribute more to the company innovation activities.

And this honor is shared with our IH colleagues and platform team, their guidance and support of the 9381 product is key to the successful deliveries. This honor is also shared with all kinds of help/support received from other products/teams!

Team members worked overtime to overcome many difficulties such as tight schedules, heavy tasks, and big challenges, and successfully completed the development and PoC of the FastTrack MTC platform product on VMM-HI – a new machine type communication product for Nokia Alcatel-Lucent Qingdao R&D Center. MN QD Agile Jounery 2018 - 2nd session

This week, Agile Coach chalk talk and 2 trainings ("system thinking" and "Agile Scrum Master" ) were hold successfully. 
Enping (NOKIA HZ) not only delivered excellent trainings, but also share the good agile practise of NOKIA HZ. it is also dicussed how to build a efficient and self-organized team. We believe all of those experince and knowledge will help us to launch SAFe in the following month.

body.parsed:
With the support from Joanna Kwolek & Michal Stankiewicz, two Lego4DevOps pilots were held successfully in Qingdao TC. From these two pilots, we not only enjoyed the Lego game, but also understood the DevOps culture. We should clearly know our objectives before starting, we should break barriers between Dev & Ops, we should pay more attention to common goals, we should work & communicate more closely to solve the problems, etc. Thanks all the participants, you made an excellent job. Thanks Matrix Wang who provided the Lego blocks.
The pilots are done, however our journey is just started. Now the game is open to all Qingdao TC. Are you ready to play Lego4DevOps with us? If you want to join, type in "Lego4DevOps" in the comments field under this post. Or you can send an email to me(aaron.a.liu@nokia-sbell.com) or Summer Zhang(yaxing.zhang@nokia-sbell.com). Thank you for your attention.
Note that the game does not require any knowledge of DevOps nor is any specific role demanded. Also, the players do not need to be from the same team. Feel free to join.

attachments.content_excerpt:
I’m happy to inform you that I have completed my L6S Green Belt certification project “Reduce CTS New Customer Defect Reports (NCDR)”. The goal of the project was to reduce CTS NCDR more than 30%. As a result, the NCDR reduce 69%, saving 295.7K EUR.

My project details can be found at: https://sharenet-ims.int.net.nokia.com/Overview/D558231189

Many thanks to everyone who supported me in this certification, Sponsor Zhang, Klaus (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Champion Bian, Michael (NSB - CN/Qingdao), MBB Zhou, Victor (NSB - CN/Beijing) and CTS team members.
Special thanks to my Mentor, Yue, Amy (NSB - CN/Beijing), for professional guidance and great cooperation.

cc: Yue, Amy (Nokia - CN/Beijing), Bian, Michael (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhang, Klaus (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhou, Victor (NSB - CN/Beijing)

body.parsed: A two-days SOS First Aid training is held at QingDao site at May 11&12. There are ~40 people attend the training. The professional coach Liu Wei and Wang Hui from QingDao Red Cross delivered the wonderful classroom training as well as hands-on training about the CPR(Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation), Bandage, Casualty handling, Earthquake escaping..etc. The students attended and passed the hands-on test for CPR and Bandage together with the online test to be certified first aid person. It is a meaningful and full day!

attachments.title: CoDe Champions Awards - January-March 2018 announcements made!
attachments.content_excerpt:
Dear Colleagues,

We are honoured to present the DU and TC Silver CoDe Champions awarded in 2018 Q1 round. Congratulations to all of you and big thanks for all of your amazing contribution into the Competence Development!
The main purpose of this MN CoDe's #codechampions is to recognize those of you who openly and significantly contribute to Competence Development amongst others by creating new content, sharing the available and new content, making learning approachable and above all supporting CoDe activities. We encourage you to learn the rules by which this program is played by on the dedicated sharepoint site (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/codeformnpcc/codechamp/SitePages/Home.aspx).

Your MN CoDe Core Team

cc: Stakias, Pantelis (Nokia - GR/Athens), Cervenca-Lates, Augustin (Nokia - RO/Timisoara), Zonza, Michele (Nokia - IT/Vimercate), Ghezzi, Marco (Nokia - IT), Dziemianko, Katarzyna (Nokia - PL/Wroclaw), Cicchiello, Sara (Nokia - DE/Ulm)

body.parsed:
PMP Symposium between NOKIA Qingdao and Qingdao Huatong Group 

PMP Symposium between NOKIA Qingdao and Qingdao Huatong Group was successfully held on May 5th. Three companies from Huatong Group joined this seminar besides Nokia Qingdao. 

Turing Luo, the senior project manager from Nokia Qingdao was invited to host the seminar. He delivered great topics on "Project Management Service Business", and shared in-depth project management experience. The session was highly recognized by all the participants and consensus was reached on deep cooperation in technological sharing and exploration in the future.

body.parsed: Here is the China Cloud Core Market update from global PPS team.
body.plain: Here is the China Cloud Core Market update from global PPS team.(1 Share attached)
body.rich: Here is the China Cloud Core Market update from global PPS team.

attachments.content_excerpt:
China Cloud Core Market Opportunities

Nihao! please see below the highlights from my recent China customer visit on Cloud Core topics:

1. China Mobile expects to keep their 2G/3G network still for long time due to NB IoT SMS authentication. They plan Cloud MSS trial in 2018 and proceed with R4 modernization in 2019 to use cloud MSS. Cloud MGW is not required at moment. SDL will be required only in year 2019 or later
2. China Mobile NFV project result for cloud hardware: NFV hardware CP1 2018 vendor selection are ZTE and H3C. CMCC will conduct new HW selection tests in 2018 and we will make sure we have competitive Airframe offering for that trial.
3. MSS/MGW modernization progresses in many CMCC provinces.
4. 5G is hot topics in many CMCC provinces: Nokia 5G Core Roadshow started in FJMCC and other provinces.
5. If you do not know who is H3C, new vendor to compete with airframe. Check out the link: http://www.h3c.com/en/AboutNewH3C/History/

In short, lot of activities in China market for Cloud Core!
regards, Lili

messages.title: 【MN CoDE 】“Knowledge Contest” Activity

body.parsed:
The Learning Index is the way to monitor the continuous learning culture. In order to encourage all colleagues to learn continuously, course “Introduction to 5G elearning| CUTM8014-01A (https://nokialearn.csod.com/LMS/LoDetails/DetailsLo.aspx?loid=548b4a1b-efd6-4bf2-9444-e7b0a5b64c47&query=?q=Introduction%20to%205G%20elearning%7C%20CUTM8014-01A#t=1)” is recommended by QD MN CoDE in March. Right now a deliberated activity is prepared for us bases on the knowledge you learnt, that is “Knowledge Contest”. Hope each colleague can join, and the participants with high score will be rewarded J

Deadline：2018.5.4

How to join:
1. Scan below QR code,
2. Input your name, Dept. and email address (company),
3. Answer the questions,
4. Submit.

body.parsed:
2018 Q1 Qingdao LD Activity Volunteer Award 

There are 4 activity volunteers recognized as good volunteers in their project with best award by Qingdao TC office in Q1.
They have good engagement and great contribution in their project, which brought us enjoyable and impressive activities.
Below are the 4 winners’ good stories.

1.	Stacy Liu from TC activity--- Quality Week in Mar
Stacy Liu is nominated for her excellent work to coordinate quality week @ Qingdao.  
Hundreds of engineers gain the benefit from the program by participating information sharing, RCA/EDA, SW robustness training as well as IQ training.  It is a great success with 95% satisfaction rate! Thanks Stacy for her great effort to lead the activity and promote the quality mindset in the site.

2.	Lisa Zhang from WLN – Women’s Day in 3/8
Lisa Zhang is nominated for her excellent leadership in QD WLN team, especially with her exceptional effort on coordinating the Women’s Day Celebration @ Qingdao.  
The Women’s Day celebration party preparation lasted for more than 1 month. Lisa led the team working on every details with their spare time and finally cooked this special and memorable event on March 8th 2018. More than 350 female engineers attended the party in two locations of QD site, and all of them are being valued, encouraged, and touched by this event. Thanks Lisa for her great effort to lead the activity and promote the momentum for all female team members in the site. 

3.	Ellen Yang from CoDE – Professional Comes in Jan
Ellen Yang is appreciated for supporting on “Professor Comes” Project in Qingdao TC CoDE.
Ellen well drives “Professor Comes” Project which is an internal Training Project. Its purpose is to provide the internal training sessions to Qingdao TC colleagues to improve their competence. To make learning easy and fun, Ellen introduced a series of system into Training Team and advertised the CoDE activities with attractive monthly push post.  This post email draw a lot attention when we shared this as the best practice in the China CoDE guild.

4.	Park Yang from Innovation – Innovation Day in Jan
Park Yang is nominated for his excellent work to coordinate Innovation Day in Qingdao.
In order to fully show the excellent innovation of Qingdao R&D in Innovation Day activity, Park, together with team members show the joint efforts from the selection of projects, the completion of the project, to the innovation results, and make the innovation projects more prominent, and more influence with wide range participant.
 
Thanks for their contribution in Q1 LD activities again!

QD TC Office

body.rich:
2018 Q1 Qingdao LD Activity Volunteer Award

There are 4 activity volunteers recognized as good volunteers in their project with best award by Qingdao TC office in Q1.
They have good engagement and great contribution in their project, which brought us enjoyable and impressive activities.
Below are the 4 winners’ good stories.

1. Stacy Liu from TC activity--- Quality Week in Mar
Stacy Liu is nominated for her excellent work to coordinate quality week @ Qingdao.
Hundreds of engineers gain the benefit from the program by participating information sharing, RCA/EDA, SW robustness training as well as IQ training. It is a great success with 95% satisfaction rate! Thanks Stacy for her great effort to lead the activity and promote the quality mindset in the site.

2. Lisa Zhang from WLN – Women’s Day in 3/8
Lisa Zhang is nominated for her excellent leadership in QD WLN team, especially with her exceptional effort on coordinating the Women’s Day Celebration @ Qingdao.
The Women’s Day celebration party preparation lasted for more than 1 month. Lisa led the team working on every details with their spare time and finally cooked this special and memorable event on March 8th 2018. More than 350 female engineers attended the party in two locations of QD site, and all of them are being valued, encouraged, and touched by this event. Thanks Lisa for her great effort to lead the activity and promote the momentum for all female team members in the site.

3. Ellen Yang from CoDE – Professional Comes in Jan
Ellen Yang is appreciated for supporting on “Professor Comes” Project in Qingdao TC CoDE.
Ellen well drives “Professor Comes” Project which is an internal Training Project. Its purpose is to provide the internal training sessions to Qingdao TC colleagues to improve their competence. To make learning easy and fun, Ellen introduced a series of system into Training Team and advertised the CoDE activities with attractive monthly push post. This post email draw a lot attention when we shared this as the best practice in the China CoDE guild.

4. Park Yang from Innovation – Innovation Day in Jan
Park Yang is nominated for his excellent work to coordinate Innovation Day in Qingdao.
In order to fully show the excellent innovation of Qingdao R&D in Innovation Day activity, Park, together with team members show the joint efforts from the selection of projects, the completion of the project, to the innovation results, and make the innovation projects more prominent, and more influence with wide range participant.

Thanks for their contribution in Q1 LD activities again!

QD TC Office

cc: Xie, Crystal 1. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Li, Xin Vincent (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Li, Ellen J. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Yang, Park (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Liu, Stacy (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Wang, Matrix (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Yang, Ellen (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhang, Lisa LZ. (NSB - CN/Qingdao)

attachments.title: Congratulations on International Girls in ICT Day
attachments.content_excerpt:
On behalf of Mike:

Dear Female Colleagues,

April 26th is International Girls in ICT Day, I would like to take this opportunity to express sincere gratitude to you for your hard work and contributions to the company and the whole ICT industry.

Mike Wang

Background information:
International Girls in ICT Day, an initiative backed by all ITU Member States, aims to create a global environment that empowers and encourages girls and young women to consider careers in the growing field of ICTs, enabling both girls and technology companies to reap the benefits of greater female participation in the ICT sector.

body.parsed:
2018青岛“国际信息通信年轻女性日” 圆满结束
2018 Qing Dao "Girls in ICT Day" activity has successfully concluded

举办“国际信息通信年轻女性日”是Qingdao Nokia WLN team每年的例行活动。2018年4月20日下午，诺基亚青岛携手青岛大学开展了“国际信息通信年轻女性日”活动。旨在鼓励女大学生加入信息通信技术行业，助力女大学生们开展职业之旅。
"Girls in ICT Day" is an annual activities of Qingdao Nokia WLN Team. On the afternoon of April 20, 2018, Nokia Qingdao Center and QingDao University joined hands to carry out the "Girls in ICT Day" activity in order to encourage female students to join the industry of information and communication technology, help female college students to start their career journey.

该活动由诺基亚青岛WLN发起，与青岛大学共同举办。来自青岛大学信息通信类专业的20名女同学带着她们对未来职业选择和发展的憧憬和困惑参加了此次活动。
This activity was organized by Nokia Qingdao WLN and QingDao University. With various questions about future career choice and development, more than 20 female students from QingDao University participated in this activity.

活动伊始，Ellen对女大学生的到来致欢迎词，教授女性在信息通信领域如何做职业生涯规划、传授如何成为一名优秀员工的经验。青岛地区WLN组织 (女性领导力组织) 负责人为同学们介绍了公司对创新的支持，并重点介绍了女性员工在创新活动中的贡献。
At the beginning, TC leader Ellen welcomed the arrival of female college students and shared how to do career planning in information communication field and also shared how to become an excellent employee. The leader of WLN team made a brief introduction of Nokia innovation strategy, and the female engineers’ great contribution in innovation activities.

随后，诺基亚研发高级经理，创新车库带头人Matrix Wang为大家讲解创新。为了让大家更好的掌握创新方法，以workshop的形式带领大学生尝试构建以客户为中心的项目。将20名学生分为4组，每组讨论自己的主题。Matrix Wang 引领大家如何从客户角度来构思项目，如何提供解决方案，并最终以乐高的形式来搭建原型支撑项目，寓教于乐。活动现场气氛非常活跃，同学们情绪高涨，积极投入到现场活动中。
Later, NOKIA R&D manager, innovation garage leader, Matrix Wang, explained the detail innovation methodology for everyone. In order to let everyone quickly grasp the innovative method, Matrix instructed everyone to try to build a customer-centric project with workshop. Twenty students were divided into four groups and each group discussed their own theme. Matrix Wang led everyone in how to think about projects from the perspective of customers, how to provide solutions, and finally led to build prototype support projects in the form of Lego. The atmosphere of the workshop was very lively. The students were very emotional and actively participated in the live activities.

本次“国际信息通信年轻女性日”给青岛大学的同学们留下了深刻印象，同学们纷纷表示自己从中受益匪浅，学会如何为自己的未来做好充分准备。另外，本次活动也被学生们整理发布到青岛大学PDU计科研究生公众号，有很好的校园反响，并引起了广大学生对创新和ICT行业更多的憧憬和向往。
After “Girls in ICT Day” activity, students feedback that they learnt a lot from this easy-going Nokia innovation style, and learned how to prepare for their future. Furthermore, they said that they were looking forward to the next “Girls in ICT Day” in Nokia Qingdao. In addition this activity summary was reported by the students to the public account of the Graduate School of PDU, Qingdao University and gained very good feedback from other students and many of them shared the vision of being a member of innovation and contribute their talents in ICT industry after graduate.

body.parsed:
The 2nd Hackathon and International Innovation Competition in Qingdao

The 2nd Qingdao hackathon and international innovation competition was opened on Apr 20th. The competition is jointly sponsored by Nokia Qingdao and Qingdao incubation community. We also got the support from Qingdao Municipal Science and Technology Bureau, Qingdao Municipal Party committee, Qingdao incubator Association, Qingdao Computer Software Society and so on. 

The theme of the event is “Coding to intelligent era” with three sub-directions: Internet, intelligent manufacturing, electronic information and communication industry. More than 20 teams joined this event and worked together from the idea brainstorm, product planning to coding development and testing. Wow, 54-hour hard working makes the idea into the reality. 

Hackathon event has created a lively, free and energetic atmosphere of innovation and entrepreneurship. It has built a great platform for more young people to exchange ideas, spark passion, and strengthen cooperation and cooperation.

Hackathon event has created a lively, free and energetic atmosphere of innovation and entrepreneurship. It has built a great platform for more young people to exchange ideas, spark passion, and strengthen cooperation and cooperation.

How to become an assessor?
 *Check this material: https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/#/files/130120233 or
 *Send an email to DevOpsMaturityAssessorGuild@groups.nokia.com and explain that you are interested in joining a highly motivated team of DevOps evangelists. Guild members will give more instructions (e.g. what trainings, self-study packages, etc. shall be taken in order to become an assessor).

body.parsed:
The result for QD G1HB survey

Total 43 participants  joined the survey and 29 of 43 contributed their pain points and good suggestions ,ideas in question 3-5 which need input manually. The meeting efficiency and working efficiency are the two major items from the survey. We have set the action plan and discussed with WR,IT,MCA, the new program will be proposed soon.
 Thanks again for their contribution and supports! The small gifts and best ideas awards are coming soon.

Shark Tank Campaign Launch 

Cloud Core is now seeking for your innovative ideas that are relevant to Cloud Core products and could lead to new business opportunities or product efficiency improvements.

 During April and May we are especially interested in ideas related to Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, but also ideas from other areas are welcome.

 Are you ready to confront the “Sharks”?

attachments.content_excerpt:
Shark Tank GIM campaign launch

One of the key objectives of Cloud Core is to build an innovation friendly environment. In this frame, the Shark Tank process was introduced to the whole Cloud Core in January 2018 after piloting the original idea in cSDM during the second half of 2017.
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/sharktank/SitePages/Home.aspx

Shark tank initiative is an easy way to accelerate implementation of innovative ideas and deliver results – It creates a room for “Try-out and fail fast”. The evaluation process is simple and efficient, to take a closer look at the timeline or budget for implementation.

We are now seeking for your innovative ideas that are relevant to Cloud Core products and could lead to new business opportunities or product efficiency improvements.

During April and May we are especially interested in ideas related to Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, but also ideas from other areas are welcome.

Are you ready to confront the “Sharks”?
If so, please submit your ideas at the Shark Tank campaign in GIM tool.
https://gim.net.nokia.com/servlet/hype/IMT?userAction=Browse&documentId=820646203f1de7a65bfbde9c73e64ae2&templateName

cc: Spyridakis, Markos (Nokia - GR/Athens), Duval, Erwan (Nokia - FR/Lannion), Szoke, Csaba (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Reiss, Matthias (Nokia - DE/Munich)

body.parsed:
Nokia 2018 Mandatory Training

For 2018, all Nokia employees will be required to complete two mandatory courses:

•	We Respect Privacy

•	Ethical Business Training: Our Code of Conduct

Mandatory courses will be launched individually in Q2; both are currently under development. Additional information regarding deployment of mandatory training will be made available by HR and NokiaEDU prior to each course’s introduction.

Mandatory training is training that all Nokia internal, permanent employees (including managers) must complete to enable them to carry out their work tasks. Mandatory training may be limited to a group or particular function of employees, or it may mean Nokia-wide, crucial training in order to help ensure:

1. Company-wide implementation of a new process or practice

2. Enforcement of a company-wide existing process or practice, way of conduct etc.

3. Company-wide competence requirement

The annual mandatory training offerings are communicated globally each year.

Access to all mandatory training programs is provided via Nokia’s Learning Store.

For more information about Mandatory Training please review the Mandatory Training SOP and the Mandatory Training Q&A.

For more information about Mandatory Training reporting please go to NokiaEDU Reporting Site

attachments.title: New #AI / #ML content now available: Towards Enhanced Artificial Intelligence
attachments.content_excerpt:
📼 watch  (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/portals/hub/_layouts/15/PointPublishing.aspx?app=video&p=p&chid=6cb8cc70-6f9a-4828-9017-4ac9886e7a8f&vid=20574445-0f43-4fcb-8135-4a9edbb28a94)[AI NEWSCAST@ESPOO]Towards Enhanced Artificial Intelligence by MIKKO UUSITALO, Head of Research Department Wireless Advanced Technologies / Nokia Bell Labs Finland

Mikko gives an overview on what is known about the current human definition of intelligence, the brain, as well as the current basis of artificial intelligence, the CMOS and transistor-based computers running machine-learning- based algorithms.
He also presents alternative options for the basis of future artificial intelligence. His presentation includes results from Mikko and his colleagues towards helping Nokia to compete in building competitive communication systems in a shorter term and it ends with a look at what to expect from artificial intelligence tomorrow and beyond.

📼 watch (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/portals/hub/_layouts/15/PointPublishing.aspx?app=video&p=p&chid=6cb8cc70-6f9a-4828-9017-4ac9886e7a8f&vid=20574445-0f43-4fcb-8135-4a9edbb28a94) now!    For more #ai/#ml content, check this MN CoDe site (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/codeformnpcc/aiml/SitePages/Home.aspx). For other Nokia strategic competencies, check the #stracomp main site (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/codeformnpcc/stratcomp/SitePages/Home.aspx).

We expect the next technical forum。

Nokia Quality Awards

Sponsored by our CEO Rajeev Suri, the Nokia Quality Awards™ is an annual competition recognizing and rewarding outstanding achievements of living quality through actions and mindset. All colleagues and Teams at Nokia can compete in three categories. The application period runs from 3rd April to 4th May, 2018. In-depth evaluations are conducted by panels of business assessors, who produce a short list by September.

Please refer to below link for details.
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/qualityaward/SitePages/Home.aspx 
In case of Nokia Quality Awards, please use Nokia Quality yammer group or write to Marianne Bailey.

attachments.title: A message from Said Berrahil: Launching testing skillset
attachments.content_excerpt:
Dear colleagues,

Quality is the central success factor for Nokia and Mobile Networks, and we need - and want - to invest in this area to be world class. As it is our ambition to deliver high quality products and solutions it is essential for us to test our products and to eliminate all bugs before they get deployed.

With this ambition in mind, we are now establishing a testing skillset which focuses on testing teams and R&D engineers:
- Curriculum on testing for developers (dedicated to R&D tribes)
- Curriculum on SW test automation (dedicated to Productization tribes)

These Curricula consist of 3 levels:
- Basic (on MN level) – Providing overall knowledge on the topic
- Intermediate (per DU) – DU specific deep dive
- Advanced (per DU) – To become an expert

The basic level testing skillset training – a) for developers and b) for SW test automation – is now available in the Learning Tool (https://nokialearn.csod.com/GlobalSearch/search.aspx?s=&q=Basic%20level%20Testing). Every employee in Mobile Networks R&D is asked to complete at least one level (basic/intermediate/advanced) in 2018. The development of the curriculum has been a joint effort of the following Development Units: Cloud Core, HetRAN, MANO, MN China, SmallCell, Smart Radio, SRAN, CDS, 4G RAN and NokiaEDU. To complete the training in 2018 is the target for the employees of all of these DUs.

The learning goals of the curricula are to understand:

Curriculum on testing for developers:
- Processes (incl. DevOps and Agile testing)
- Techniques (from fundamentals up to Quality control)
- Usage of different tools

Curriculum on SW test automation:
- Basic understanding about the Test Automation (TA) environment, tools and techniques
- Workshops about using and improving TA
- Become Linux expert and train others on TA

Our future training programs will include dedicated paths for each functional role introduced in the basic level curriculum. The content of these programs will be created by the subject matter experts working in these roles already today. More details on this will be shared in the coming months.

The basic level is available now, other levels will be published soon:
- Testing Skillset – Basic level for developer | MN00831-K-1803 (https://nokialearn.csod.com/DeepLink/ProcessRedirect.aspx?module=lodetails&lo=7030b4aa-132d-4f77-880d-d6f6ab5c016e)
- Testing Skillset – Basic level for SW test automation | MN00832-K-1803 (https://nokialearn.csod.com/LMS/LoDetails/DetailsLo.aspx?loid=2b6003b6-5c2f-4215-8f53-3ed7ee38bdc3)
- Testing Skillset – Basic level for HW test automation (under creation)

Thorsten Henke (https://eur.delve.office.com/?u=d6cf4e58-3212-4df5-be24-dee4c8e63770&v=work), MN 4G RAN Productization Ulm, is leading the testing skillset activities in Mobile Networks. In case you have any questions concerning the testing skillset and the target for 2018, please don’t hesitate to contact him directly.

I encourage all of you to invest time in this area as we continue on our journey to become world class.

Best regards,
Said Berrahil (https://eur.delve.office.com/?u=20317dbb-0ce2-40d2-9c33-198e97275cf6&v=work)

cc: Berrahil, Said (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Henke, Thorsten (Nokia - DE/Ulm)

attachments.title: Learning Index Explained: Learning Index (LI) vs 48 hours of waiting
attachments.content_excerpt:
With the #learningindexexplained series here started we want to make sure all of your Learning Index (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/learn/achiev/SitePages/index.aspx#myindex) -related, recurring questions are covered properly with just one post. We made it as easy to share and straightforward content-wise. Today, the 48 hrs waiting period is the main hero of the newly started series.   Please make sure to share this message on in your yammer groups. Thank you! 
Q: Why doesn’t my Learning Index (LI) get updated even though I completed my training?
A: Your LI is updated two days (48 hrs)  after completing a training offering. 

cc: Cicchiello, Sara (Nokia - DE/Ulm), Vaillant, Benoit (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Chamberlain, Jonathan (Nokia - GB/Huntingdon), Zonza, Michele (Nokia - IT/Vimercate)

attachments.title: New #AI / #ML content now available: Finnish Center for Artificial Intelligence (FCAI) and Nokia Center for Advanced Research (NCAR): towards AI supported networks and services
attachments.content_excerpt:
📖 read (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/codeformnpcc/aiml/Shared%20Documents/Kari%20Aaltonen)   📼 watch (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/portals/hub/_layouts/15/PointPublishing.aspx?app=video&p=p&chid=6cb8cc70-6f9a-4828-9017-4ac9886e7a8f&vid=52206922-7be2-4a75-91ee-bdcdf7801398)  [AI NEWSCAST@ESPOO]
Finnish Center for Artificial Intelligence (FCAI) and Nokia Center for Advanced Research (NCAR): towards AI supported networks and services by Kari Aaltonen, Nokia Bell Labs; Professor Sasu Tarkoma, University of Helsinki; Dr. Ashwin Rao, University of Helsinki

Intro by Kari Aaltonen from Bell Labs.
In this talk, Sasu Tarkoma and Dr. Ashwin Rao will give an overview of the Finnish Center for AI (FCAI) and the Nokia Center for Advanced Research (NCAR), and then focus on network and AI related research at NCAR. First, they present the key highlights pertaining to AI assisted network optimization and supporting efficient and extensible KPI information dissemination in mobile networks. Then as a unified example, they will present their data science flagship project called MegaSense aiming for planet-scale environmental sensing with 5G supported by AI technologies.

Sasu Tarkoma is a Professor of Computer Science at the University of Helsinki, and Head of the Department of Computer Science. He has authored 4 textbooks and has published over 160 scientific articles. His research interests are Internet technology, distributed systems, data analytics, and mobile and ubiquitous computing. He has eight granted US Patents. His research has received several Best Paper awards and mentions, for example at IEEE PerCom, IEEE ICDCS, ACM CCR, and ACM OSR.

Ashwin Rao is a Post-doctoral researcher working under the supervision of Sasu Tarkoma in the NODES research group at the University of Helsinki. He did the PhD in the DIANA (previously Planete) project team at Inria Sophia-Antipolis, and he obtained his master’s degree from the School of Information Technology at the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi.

For more #ai/#ml content, check this MN CoDe site (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/codeformnpcc/aiml/SitePages/Home.aspx).
For other Nokia strategic competencies, check the #stracomp main site (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/codeformnpcc/stratcomp/SitePages/Home.aspx).

cc: Falk, Henna (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Rytkonen, Marika (Nokia - FI/Espoo)

body.parsed:
Turing Luo takes leadership for Qingdao Site SAFe Deployment  
  
Turing Luo is taking the leadership to coordinate Qingdao Site SAFe Deployment. A agile coach guild is also formed to build the local agile coach competence. Please talk to Turing, Reicer, Sarah or Aaron if you are interested in the agile guild.

Turing is the senior transformation leader with rich experience in Agile/DevOps area. He has delivered SAFe basic training in Q1, 2018. Thanks for Turing's willingness to take this responsibility for Qingdao site, and thanks for all teams’ great support to him to ensure Qingdao SAFe deployment to be successful.

Coming important SAFe event in Qingdao is SAFe Change Agent training which is planned in M06 or M07, Welcome for more details shared by Turing.

attachments.title: "Creating effective visual presentations" launched
attachments.content_excerpt:
Have you ever thought how to create a presentation that is clear enough but also visually effective?

Our new technique “Creating effective visual presentations (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/:p:/s/EmployeeExperience/EXt32fWitXdNlb-BGsmdE3oB2LAcLrJaT9YmRtri9KcydQ)” gives you understanding about typography and layout basics, helps you to select visuals that supports your message and guides you how to share data effectively.

Please also check the recorded session (https://nokialearn.csod.com/LMS/LoDetails/DetailsLo.aspx?loid=1871bf52-d74b-45d9-ac64-b99e624c5a6b#t=1) in Learning store and earn learning points.

attachments.title: Sharing Sessions are available again!
attachments.content_excerpt:
The Sharing Session feature is back. 

We changed drastically the way data are processed so that no credit point is lost. We recovered all the missing points and this morning several hundreds of session participants have been credited learning points.

As previously, points are credited once per day, so do not expect to see your index increase the minute you rate a session.

Thank you for your patience and your understanding.

body.plain:

We changed drastically the way data are processed so that no credit point is lost. We recovered all the missing points and this morning several hundreds of session participants have been credited learning points.

As previously, points are credited once per day, so do not expect to see your index increase the minute you rate a session.

Thank you for your patience and your understanding.

Materials including recorded training video are uploaded to below SharePoint.

Please be noted the first 20 minutes in the video should be skipped.

attachments.title: [Learning Index] Sharing Session Tool
attachments.content_excerpt: It seems the former LDH checkbox generated some confusion. We changed the way it is working so that it is more intuitive. You need now to check it if the session is not managed in LDH and you want the participants to get learning points when they rate the session. In addition, the checkbox is checked by default in order to prevent any mistake.

attachments.title: #LearningIndex - Before you ask
attachments.content_excerpt:
It has been a couple of months with Learning Index functioning, the tool created to foster the learning culture across Nokia. There are still many questions recurring, though, such as:
1) How long does it take for my points to be updated in the Index?
2) How many points do I get for Learning, Sharing a session and communicatiing via Yammer?

Answers to these and dozens of other questions you will find in these two documents: NokiaEDU Achievement Center Frequently Asked Questions (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/learn/lpdb/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B099a2c14-cf70-45aa-b227-5f1a47739b05%7D&action=default)   |   How to get points? (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/learn/lpdb/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7Bb32a4a9b-c600-43c3-874d-301e3f15a4a3%7D&action=default) both of them available also from the level of Achievement Center menu (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/learn/achiev/SitePages/index.aspx#home).
Please feel encouraged to promote this post in your organizations. Thank you!

cc: Chamberlain, Jonathan (Nokia - GB/Huntingdon), Stakias, Pantelis (Nokia - GR/Athens), Vaillant, Benoit (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay)

attachments.content_excerpt:
A successful HetRAN 2G/3G DU GSM-A Town Hall was held in Qingdao China on Mar. 20th 2018. HetRAN 2G&3G leaders and all China GSM-A members joined this Town Hall. This is a specific and exciting Town Hall since the team started to join new projects.
Joe Soltykiewicz Head of 2G&3G R&D and Productization retrospected the 2G&3G achievements in 2017, and he pointed out that all colleagues collaboratively made an excellent results which included on-time delivery, quality assurance, low customer outage, etc. He described the definition of success in 2018. The strategy is comprised of several aspects: financials, execution, quality and transformation. By his presentation, all participants were inspired by the scores of 2017, and got a more clear view of 2018 targets.
Jean-Paul Humeau Head of GSM-A R&D Squad Group explained results and related action plan of the change map survey completed in Dec 2017. The GSM-A results have positioned the team on the transformation map in a region called ‘Achieved with Loss of Heart’ in the high performance zone. And the action plan includes two items which are learning new technologies and the competence growing of new module owners. Jean-Paul introduced the backgrounds of new projects and the schedule of Femto NB-IoT project and MN Cloud Core China Customer features. He also mentioned that the team will continue to work with and support other NOKIA development teams where appropriate, and the prerequisite is that GSM-A knowledge and maintenance capability remain secure.
GSM-A team members asked several questions in the Q&A session, including “The possible new opportunities”, “How to deal with GSM critical site issues beyond 2020”, “The market status of 4G and 5G trials in US” etc. The Town Hall meeting ended up with the questions and discussions.
By the review of 2017 and prospect of 2018, GSM-A members are fully confident that the team will become more productive and more energetic which can trigger members contribute more for the company.

cc: Soltykiewicz, Joe (Nokia - US/Naperville), Humeau, Jean-Paul (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Li, Ellen J. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Chen, Ming Seaman. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Li, Xin Vincent (NSB - CN/Qingdao)

body.parsed:
2018 GCHN sales conference 

Six China R&D centers are invited to join this event and support China sales. Park Yang, April Liu, Tongguang, Tracy and I joined this conference. Qingdao site has contributed 2 demo cases. One is Open API and another one is SBC solution in enterprise. 

Mike summaries 2017 GCHN work with three key words:Integration, Innovation, Growth. 4BG (GS, ION, FN, NSW) achieved YoY growth, MN drops, but all footprint is protected. 2018 focus on technical leadership in 5G, cloud core, 200G OTN, 10G PON and achieve 2018 sales target. Mike specially mentioned the importance of vertical and software growth.

Rajeev “joined” us with his video message. 2018 is the year of 5G with lots of opportunity. 5G is not only radio, core solution is part of the overall solution. He expects we win the 5G war in China. Mike and Alain Biston deliver the confidence with the joint effort from Global and local team. 

Deepti Arona, chief quality officer shared the importance of quality and recognized the great result of GCHN CPVi. She specially mentioned the quality week in Qingdao last week in her speech. Fantastic work🎉🎉 (thanks to Stacy Liu to organize it)

MN PPS Cloud Core head jiapeng summarized 2017 GCHN core accomplishment:top 3 in CMCC NFV test, vIMS 19% market share in CUC and CHT NGN 100% market share. In 2018, the goal is 5G core test pass rate top 3, VoLTE/NFV market share increase 15% and airframe breakthrough. 

All the strategies and thinking need to be converted into action and results. 2018 beyond: thinking, going and winning!!

cc: [[user:1640223993]], [[user:1639997387]], [[user:1640795676]], [[user:1643878061]], [[user:1639982498]]

cc: Yang, Park (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Liu, Stacy (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Li, Tongguang (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Liu, April 1. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhang, Tracy (NSB - CN/Qingdao)
body.rich:
2018 GCHN sales conference

Six China R&D centers are invited to join this event and support China sales. Park Yang, April Liu, Tongguang, Tracy and I joined this conference. Qingdao site has contributed 2 demo cases. One is Open API and another one is SBC solution in enterprise.

Mike summaries 2017 GCHN work with three key words:Integration, Innovation, Growth. 4BG (GS, ION, FN, NSW) achieved YoY growth, MN drops, but all footprint is protected. 2018 focus on technical leadership in 5G, cloud core, 200G OTN, 10G PON and achieve 2018 sales target. Mike specially mentioned the importance of vertical and software growth.

Rajeev “joined” us with his video message. 2018 is the year of 5G with lots of opportunity. 5G is not only radio, core solution is part of the overall solution. He expects we win the 5G war in China. Mike and Alain Biston deliver the confidence with the joint effort from Global and local team.

Deepti Arona, chief quality officer shared the importance of quality and recognized the great result of GCHN CPVi. She specially mentioned the quality week in Qingdao last week in her speech. Fantastic work🎉🎉 (thanks to Stacy Liu to organize it)

MN PPS Cloud Core head jiapeng summarized 2017 GCHN core accomplishment:top 3 in CMCC NFV test, vIMS 19% market share in CUC and CHT NGN 100% market share. In 2018, the goal is 5G core test pass rate top 3, VoLTE/NFV market share increase 15% and airframe breakthrough.

All the strategies and thinking need to be converted into action and results. 2018 beyond: thinking, going and winning!!

cc: Yang, Park (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Liu, Stacy (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Li, Tongguang (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Liu, April 1. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhang, Tracy (NSB - CN/Qingdao)

body.rich: Quality Education & Competence Development Model -- Various channel to build the quality competence. Sharpen the device first for a better job (工欲善其事，必先利其器).

attachments.content_excerpt:
Introducing the Quality Education & Competence Development Model

One of the key roles that the MN Quality team, as part of the MN transformation, is to help operationalize quality accountability deeper into the MN organization. This includes quality education and competence development within the MN Development Units (DUs) and Functional Units (FcUs) to better deliver the quality that our customers expect.

I am pleased to introduce the Quality Education & Competence Development Model to facilitate transfer of quality knowledge and enable effective use of quality methodologies and techniques.

This model covers the following topics for Quality Knowledge learning and development:

MN Quality Guilds hub (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/mnq_guilds/SitePages/Home.aspx):

As part of the model, the MN Quality Guild hub, a One-Stop Shop community for learning and networking on various established quality practices, has been established. The framework for the community is built around the 'CLASP' concept (Connect, Learn, Apply, Share & Promote) to effectively propagate proven quality concepts and techniques across MN organizations to foster continual improvement. Targeted to all MN Quality Staff, MN Staff whoever takes quality roles like Tribe Quality Owners, Program Owner, Technical Lead and Change Leaders, it provides access to quality domain expertise such as Quality left shift, Quality Education & Knowledge Sharing, QCI, QMS and other subjects such as Root Cause Analysis and Escaped Defects Analysis (RCA/EDA) and Quality Benchmarks.

Quality Week (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MNQualityWeek/SitePages/Home.aspx):
 Quality Week, an intensive onsite program that provides many benefits to our colleagues, from knowledge sharing, training, collaboration and innovative problem solving, is being launched across key strategic MN sites in 2018. Please access the 2018 plan and roadmap (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MNQualityWeek/Quality%20week%20value/Forms/AllItems.aspx) for more information.

Quality Knowledge Sharing Sessions:
 We have introduced Quality Knowledge Sharing Sessions (KSSs) to support competence development of new MN Tribe Quality roles. Information including KSS topics/agendas, lessons learned and more are available at the Quality Education & Knowledge Sharing Guild (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/mnq_guilds/Q-Edu/SitePages/Home.aspx):.

Quality Education & Learning path:
The Quality Education & Learning path to support Competence Development (CoDe) for MN DU Quality roles is available here. https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/mnq_guilds/Q-Edu/_layouts/15/DocIdRedir.aspx?ID=T2INPAPIUAT5-4168982-40Distribution
Note: Lists of Change Leaders, MN Q & MN DU quality roles and MN CoDe Managers, published in our MN Quality guild Community Site to support MN/Quality transformation and to connect the stakeholders, improve networking and information sharing

In addition, ad hoc training requests including requests for Quality workshop facilitators/customized sessions can be made through the Quality as a Service portal (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MNQ/SitePages/Quality%20as%20a%20Service.aspx)
And role based quality guild is hosted by DU Quality lead as business usual. You could access here (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MNQ/SitePages/MN%20Quality%20organization.aspx) to find the respective DU Quality Lead for your DU/FcU.

cc: Rouanne, Marc (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Linden, Anna (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Arora, Deepti (Nokia - US/Naperville), Schroepfer, Scott (Nokia - US/Naperville), Kumar, Maneesh 2. (Nokia - US/Naperville), Chauhan, Sunita (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Miller, Alan (Nokia - US/Irving), Lenney, Mary (Nokia - US/Murray Hill), Rajavannian, Sumathi (Nokia - IN/Bangalore)

attachments.content_excerpt:
Dream-like place, Inspiring speech, Shining crown, Graceful postures, Delicious cake, and Charming smiles… This is Nokia Qingdao R&D Women’s Day Celebration Party!
• It was such a good opportunity that we learnt from our leaders and got empowered;
• It was such a good chance to build our network and knew more about each other;
• It was such a good stage to take own close-up photos, to be a queen or princess;
• It was such a good platform that showed our talent and shared happiness together;
• It was such a good event that we‘re all empowered ourselves to be graceful, be stronger, and better us!

With great support of our leadership team, Qingdao R&D WLN team spent one and a half month to cook this memorable party on March 8th 2018. More than 300 female engineers attended this event, which held in two locations. From the laughing faces you can tell everyone were really enjoying, and their actively participating showed us: All women can be versatile and splendid in everything!!! We wish all of our females collogues more smile, more energy and more beautiful in every day!

梦幻的会场，温暖的祝福，闪亮的皇冠，曼妙的身影，美味的蛋糕，如花的笑颜…
2018年3月8日女神节庆祝活动圆满落幕，狂欢Party留给了我们最美好的回忆，亦刷遍了我们的朋友圈。J
感谢各位领导对庆祝活动的大力支持，让WLN Team有此机会为大家准备了前所未有的盛宴，一如既往地让我们的女员工们体会到公司的温暖和关怀。
感谢WLN Team的所有姐妹们以及提供支持的同事们，在这个幸福的节日里用自己默默的劳动付出去帮助大家实现那颗粉粉的少女心。
感谢所有参与庆祝活动的女神们，你们的热情和笑脸让我们的节日更具幸福感，让我们的工作更加多彩。

还没有拿到女神节专属礼物的姐妹们请注意了，请尽快到研发、老厂的WLN联系人处领走礼物，截止到3/16号吆。
新中心：Sarah Huang (2743 3237) 研发：Lyne Chu (2742 5470)

两个会场的更多精彩花絮及各位女神靓影写真，请登陆以下网址静心欣赏. http://135.252.40.207/photo/
美图写真有了，精彩视频还在精心炮制中，大家敬请期待

@Nokia Qingdao R&D WLN Team
We Share, We Help, We Learn, We Grow Together!

cc: Zhang, Tracy (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhao, Grace J. (Nokia - CN/Qingdao), Zhang, Klaus (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhou, Robbin (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Li, Ellen J. (NSB - CN/Qingdao)

Enjoy the learning and waiting for your great innovation ideas!
