body.parsed: Big applause to NTAS team for achieving the 1st P8 milestone!
body.plain: Big applause to NTAS team for achieving the 1st P8 milestone!(1 Share attached)
body.rich: Big applause to NTAS team for achieving the 1st P8 milestone!

attachments.content_excerpt:
On March 2nd, QD held the NTAS17 P8 Celebration with a big cake. It started with Tina’s video to recall how this great milestone was achieved through a lot of hard work from the global teams over 2 years and its special meaning for new cloud businesses. Then Klaus, Cody, Jason and Katie highlighted QD team’s contribution and learning from this journey:

• QD pst testers (Frank Lv, Bill Kong, Owen Zhang, Ever Dong) joined final P8 testing with involving daily 1 hr stability, 500K/2M 12hr/24/hrs/72hrs stability run; tested VM/containers level Provocative testing; reported total 74 jiras; backup Budapest pst team during Christmas holidays session.
• Recovered Vodafone India sites escalation twice during Qingdao evenings with Frank Lv, Bill Kong, Neil Nie, Tony Wang and Rocket Sun’s great work.
• Frank Lv went to Vodafone India site during Christmas holidays and supported CD7.4 upgrade for Mumbai, Punjab, Gujarat.
• QD DTD team (nvista squad: Chris Chen, Daniel Fan, Fico Wang, Hans Liu, Johnny Zhang, Joyce Wang) resolved all the SI queries from NPI and sites timely (mostly within 1 day) to help the team quickly turnaround.
• Provided the daily log analysis of the DTD logs from the Vodafone India sites. Identified the wrong network configurations on site and followed up with the service team to have it corrected.
• QD CI team (robot squad: Maple Jiang, Kevin Yu, Harold Xue, June Yu) supported the SCM/CI activities together with Budapest/Athens/Naperville team to speed up the NTAS 17.0 merge progress, and backup all the SCM/CI activities during the Christmas holiday.
• QD SCC SS7/M3UA SMEs (Sam Fang, Alpha Zhang, Billy Xu, Jane Sui, Katie Zhang) provided a provocative testing cases list of SS7/M3UA
• QD SCC SS7/M3UA SMEs provided consultation on how SCC SS7/M3UA works

Again, a big applause to the key contributors and the entire NTAS project team!

Check the excitements from the party in the videos and pictures!

cc: Hinch, Tina (Nokia - US/Naperville), Zhang, Klaus (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Li, Cody (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Ye, Jason 1. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhang, Katie (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Bian, Michael (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Liu, Tandde (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Wang, Oliver (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Xia, Daniel (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhang, Reicer (NSB - CN/Qingdao)

body.parsed:
5G应用创新大赛，等你来战！

2月26日，通信业的年度盛典 - 2018世界移动通信大会在巴塞罗那拉开帷幕。展会上，包括诺基亚在内的上千家移动通信相关企业向公众展示了5G的最新成就，使我们更加深刻地体会到，万众憧憬的5G时代，已经到来！刚刚结束的平昌冬奥会是5G 在全球范围内的首次亮相。主办方向观众提供了同步观赛、互动时间切片、360度VR直播等沉浸式5G体验服务，揭开了5G商用之幕。
       
 4G改变生活，5G改变社会。通过提供至少十倍于4G的峰值速率、毫秒级的传输时延和千亿级的连接能力5G技术将为高清视频、AR、VR等带来更极致的体验，也会给制造业、交通、医疗健康等行业带来巨大变革，开启万物广泛互联、人机深度交互的新时代。
        
为了让5G之花更加绚丽多彩，中国信通院和IMT-2020(5G)推进组决定举行面向公众的“绽放杯”5G应用征集大赛（详见http://www.imt-2020.org.cn/zh）。该项赛事的主题是“绽放5G芳华，构建应用生态”，旨在向全社会各行各业广泛征集5G应用。
        
为了响应该项赛事，NSB战略与创新部决定在公司内部展开“5G应用创新大赛”，充分发挥广大员工的技术优势和聪明才智，深度挖掘能够体现5G能力的创新应用，同时，也将作为公司参加“绽放杯”5G应用征集大赛的预选赛。


报名邮箱：Campaign.Inno@nokia-sbell.com
咨询电话：+82-21-38439579

attachments.title: Important message from the MN SAFe deployment project
attachments.content_excerpt:
SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) deployment has started in Mobile Networks. The ARTs (Agile Release Trains) and solution trains replacing the current MN releases will all be launched during 2018. The SAFe Steering Board, endorsed by Erkka Ala-Tauriala and Anna Linden, held on 16.02.2018 confirmed this strong ambition.

Radio deployment is under planning starting with 5G, MANO and ECE. In Core, the first product selected in CFX, scheduled to launch in April. First SAFe certification trainings are organized by EDU.

Before the formal training is available for your team, you can find more information from the SAFe deployment project pages (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MN_SAFe/SitePages/Home.aspx). Join the discussion on Yammer in the MN SAFe group (https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=13499192).

cc: Ala-Tauriala, Erkka (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Linden, Anna (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Rouanne, Marc (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Niemi, Berit (Nokia - FI/Espoo)

body.parsed:
Learning Index来了！！
各位小伙伴们请注意！！
2018年开始，NOKIA开始使用 Learning Index 来打造持续学习的文化，而不再使用过去的每年40小时学习的方式了

1. Learning Index是什么？
过去，我们需要每年上满40小时的课程；现在，新的模型为，2018年共需要学习92个学分，即学习指数(learning index)为100%。 当然了，勤奋好学的您如果累计超过了92个学分，您的学习指数就超过100%啦。

2. 这92个学分如何得到呢？
   有以下 3 种方式： 
   1).在Learning & Development Hub (CSOD)中完成 Training 课程  
      各组织如Squad group/Tribe/Site(或Global) 可根据各team实际培训需求 从CSOD中挑选课程 并 设置课程优先级
      学一门课程的分数 = 课时 * priorities (1.5, 1.3, 1.1 or 1.0) 
   2).在Yammer上发帖子或回帖子(不限内容): 只要发帖/回帖的字数大于20个字，将得到0.1分/每个帖子.
   3).自己添加其他课程（如Squad group和Tribes的technical forum及产品培训等）

3. 从哪里能看到我的得分？—— Nokia EDU Achievement Center
通过登录Achievement center 您可以看到您(或您的组织)的 Learning index 情况
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/learn/achiev/SitePages/index.aspx#index
进入主页后，点击左侧的 My Learning Index 选项，您将可以看到当前的得分
第一次登录时，您需要点击 “Log in with Yammer”Button，授权给Achievement Center获取Yammer数据，之后您将看到当前的Yammer得分

4. 如何知道我们可以学哪些CSOD课程呢？如何知道课程的优先级呢？
由于现阶段 青岛Site 的数据还没有同步到系统中，所以现阶段各Squad group/Tribe还不能根据各team情况从CSOD中挑选课程并设置优先级
从Achievement Center主页左侧点击进入“My Team Priorities”，可以看到您所在组织所定义的priority课程”，建议您优先学习这些课程，这样你就可以得到更多的bonus points.
由于系统问题，现阶段，有些小伙伴点开之后没有显示任何课程，则可以根据您所在tribes, squad groups 业务的需要，和您的leaders协商您的现阶段培训课程

5. 如何自己添加培训课程学时 来得分呢？
请在Achievement center 主页左侧点击 Declare Self-Defined Learning 选项查看步骤

附上几个有用的链接：
1).CSOD链接 （点击文字即可）
2).Learning store链接（这个为前NOKIA搜课链接，具体上课会redirect到CSOD上）http://learningstore.nokia.com/employee/
了解更多信息，请查看Achievement Center主页左侧 Learning Index 列表中各个选项
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/learn/achiev/SitePages/index.aspx#index

如果有技术问题，请点击主页上侧“Question & Support”到相应的Yammer group上发帖求助，或点击Here
也可以联系您所在Tribes的CoDE Managers
Cloud Core:  Jason Ye, Michael Bian
HetRAN/GSM-A: Vincent Li

body.parsed:
SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) 4.0 Workshop @ Qingdao on Feb.2nd, 2018

Around 23 trainees from GSM, MGC8, 9380, 9381 and SDM attended the half day SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) 4.0 workshop in the afternoon of Feb.2nd, 2018 at Qingdao.
The workshop covering below modules:
	Agile Base 
	SAFe Introduction
	Essential SAFe
	Lean-Agile Leader
	Lean-Agile Mindset
	Lean-Agile principles
	PI planning simulation Game.

The participants were divided into several groups to practice, everyone is anxious and exciting to play the simulation game. Comprehensive info delivered under the tight schedule, but still with vivid interaction to analyze the current situation. 
This is really an unforgettable and impressive training. We believe the participants can bring the SAFe mindset to their team in the near future. Thanks for Professor Turing to deliver this SAFe training!

attachments.title: Introducing the Learning Index
attachments.content_excerpt:
Developing our knowledge and skill sets are the most important investments we can make, for our company and ourselves. Working in a start-up mode means that we are constantly required to learn something new and do things in a different way. In order to innovate and create, our brains ask for stimulation that learning can provide. To help us keep learning at the top of our priority list and part of our daily routines, NokiaEDU is introducing a Learning Index: an easy way to find the most relevant learning for you and track your professional development throughout the year.

Here’s how your Personal Learning Index works: each time you complete a defined, recommended or freestyle learning, you earn points. Bonus points are granted for learning aligned with MN priorities. Social learning is also captured by the Index by awarding points for relevant Yammer posts. Other ways to earn learning and sharing points will be added throughout 2018. The goal is for your Squad Group to reach 100% of its recommended learning target (92 points) before year-end. Will your group be the first one to reach that target? If you want to get involved in setting your Squad, Tribe or Unit priorities, reach out to your squad/tribe lead who can work with our Competence Development (CoDe) & EDU team to adjust accordingly.

By utilizing the Index as a guide for your learning investment, you are contributing to a learning culture in MN and Nokia that ultimately supports our business and your professional success. The more you learn and share, the more points you gain. Best of all, it’s easy to use: all learning in Nokia’s Learning and Development Hub and sharing via Yammer are automatically linked to the Index and calculated for you.

Your personal Learning Index is already set up and waiting for you – access it here at the Achievement Center (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/learn/achiev/SitePages/index.aspx#home), along with videos, FAQs and other helpful information. Post any questions or comments here on the Mobile Networks Yammer group (https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=7138094&view=all).
Learning makes a difference. Our commitment to learning starts here…enjoy the journey!

cc: Fasce, Sergio (Nokia - IT/Vimercate), Chamberlain, Jonathan (Nokia - GB/Huntingdon), Eck, J (Nokia - US), Kuhn, Katja (Nokia - FI/Espoo)

body.parsed:
MN Change Map – Qingdao TC. 

Many thanks to the Qingdao TC team for high participation rate (98%) in December Change Map Survey. In total, Qingdao TC is landed in the "Battling it out". This region is characterized by high Vision and Direction and Accountability, reasonable Business Leadership, Team Leadership and good Communication. There is a lot of change taking place, with only some obstacles. Teams are not well resourced, either for people or for systems. 

The top issue of this region is Fear and Frustration. We've defined a few actions in the TC level to address team's issue. We will follow up and keep you posted. 

Meanwhile I strongly encourage you to take time to review the CLoud Core level's change map plan shared by Hanna Merisalo. The leaders really commited their effort and energy to take care of team's concern. 

Let's build for a higher performance team together.

cc: [[user:1538531304]]

attachments.content_excerpt:
MN Change Map – Cloud Core #mnchangemap

Many thanks to the Cloud Core team for high participation rate (89%) in December Change Map Survey. On the positive side Communication and Team Leadership are the top drivers and above the norm. Team Work, skills & staffing and accountability are the lowest values in the DU. In total Cloud Core landed in the region “Struggling under pressure” which is part of the Unsustainable zone. While this is not a good spot to be you very clearly expressed the areas which need change and improvement. On the overall level Cloud Core LT is focusing to the five key areas listed below while Tribes and Squad Groups are working on their more specific items in the Change Journey:

• Vision and Direction
• MN Transformation
• Roles and Responsibilities
• Squad Team Leadership
• Career Path

Focus areas and actions are explained more thoroughly in the document that can be found here: https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MN_CultureRenewal/_layouts/15/DocIdRedir.aspx?ID=B4IAPR2INT2S-412652119-105

Link to Cloud Core Change Map results report: https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MN_CultureRenewal/_layouts/15/DocIdRedir.aspx?ID=B4IAPR2INT2S-412652119-71

Link to Tribes and Squad Groups level results sharing and action planning: https://nokia.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/MN_CultureRenewal/Change%20Map%20Journey%20Action%20Planning/MN%20CC?csf=1

body.parsed:
Mike Wang's morning tea -- Feb 5th.   

2017 Q4 very strong!

上周公司发布了第四季度财报，非常亮眼，股票上涨[鼓掌][鼓掌]其中包括销售67亿欧元、毛利率41.7%、OP 15.1%；诺基亚通讯毛利率37.6%、OP 11.1%。表示我们五大网络业务端到端策略奏效，对即将到来的5G商业部署有着正面的效果。大中华区表现非常好6.54亿欧元，同比增加7%，超宽带、ION、AA和GS同比都有进步[强][强]感谢全公司大家的努力[抱拳][抱拳][抱拳]

body.parsed:
When we transformed into Nokia culture, one of the first TC task was to define/refine the site's vision and site identity. I feel very sorry that the message is not clearly shared and delivered. The site vision and site identity is defined by the site leadership team and will be refined quarterly to align with the business strategy.   

In the past few months, we have hosted a few global leaders: HetRAN DU Head, HR Region Head and CloudCore DU Head. During leaders' visit, we shared Qingdao site vision and site identity. We promote the site and seek for more opportunities. What's more important, we should share with everyone here so that we can fight for Our Progressive Vision. 

Qingdao site vision: Taking the leading position as Cloud-native Core Solution and IoT Business Incubation Center. You may find more from the attached slides which we shared for our global leaders.

attachments.title: Message from Berit Niemi: Moving forward with SAFe deployment in Mobile Networks
attachments.content_excerpt:
Current MN business operational models can’t capture the full revenue opportunities due to slow time-to-market cycles and the lack of digitalized Software delivery. Long time-to-market cycles implicate delayed revenues and higher risk of wasted effort. We have reached as an organization a tipping point where a significant transformation is highly needed if we want to stay in the market. This transformation has already been decided and announced in October, and we are now full speed working towards laying the foundations for the future by deploying SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) and DevOps across MN. The MN SAFe deployment project team is now working full speed towards creating the path to a successful deployment. In a workshop help last week, the participants reached a common level of understanding what SAFe is and what will change for MN while adopting this framework, agreed the MoO for the deployment project and created the first draft proposal for the deployment . The attached images provide some information on why we need to deploy SAFe, what will change and what will be the MN SAFe key principles. Make sure you join the conversation in MN SAFE yammer for more up to date information!

cc: Rouanne, Marc (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Linden, Anna (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Ala-Tauriala, Erkka (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Niemi, Berit (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Vainio, Timo (Nokia - FI/Espoo)

body.parsed:
Qingdao TC Future X Award (Leading for Change) - Turing Luo/ Leading transformation & change of the MSS&MGW QD 

It is a good experince to lead the change and transformation of MSS&MGW QD tirbe and got below achievements in 2017:
(1).The landing position of the team moved to High Performance zone from On Track Zone.
(2).Certified 3 Green Belt.
(3).Total saving of Lean initiatives reached 483k€ (target 263.4 k€) in 2017.
(4).FTC decreased from 32.7 days to 12.2 days
(5).Number open fault decreased from 38 to 14 . 

Thanks team's great support. Let's work together to achieve more in the new year.

(2).Certified 3 Green Belt.
(3).Total saving of Lean initiatives reached 483k€ (target 263.4 k€) in 2017.
(4).FTC decreased from 32.7 days to 12.2 days
(5).Number open fault decreased from 38 to 14 .

Thanks team's great support. Let's work together to achieve more in the new year.

body.parsed:
QIC Final Readout at Qingdao TC

12/20/2017, Wednesday, Nokia Qingdao QIC Final Readout was held in Qingdao R&D. Over hundreds of engineers that full of energy and creativity joined this quality improvement big event. 
Totally, 28 teams registered the activity of 2017 Nokia Qingdao QIC activity, and finally with the middle-year competition and QIC open day, only 10 teams have chance to join the QIC Final Readout. 

Every team show their good quality improvement practice on their product, and share the best experience with each other. Many R&D engineers from different product line work together to discuss how to improve the quality with good and efficient way. With the whole day competition, all 10 teams have good result and every member at the QIC final readout learn much about quality improvement .

attachments.content_excerpt:
To the MN Squad Group Leader Community,
As I write this I am stuck in Miami as a major storm is pummeling the northeastern US. Now some might say that Miami is not a bad place to get stuck in but the old adage comes to mind that there truly is “No place like home.” Hopefully, deciding to keep my Thursday flight and gamble on the air traffic control system instead of trying to leave earlier today is the last bad decision I make in 2018! Speaking of 2018, first, I’d like to wish all of you a very healthy, happy and prosperous New Year. As we all know, 2017 was a year full of challenges and many will continue on into 2018 but the light at the end of tunnel is starting to glimmer just a bit as the momentum is beginning to build on our new MoO in Mobile Networks.
2017 was a year of massive change especially in MN with more change in the last 3 months than I have sometimes seen in years over my career! At times it seemed like we were on a treadmill, increasing speed to the point of exhaustion with no time to relax. At other times it seemed like the continuous flow of requests for additional information with tight due dates was overwhelming. Add to this the continuous messaging from our customers that they were not yet seeing the power of the new Nokia resulting in their questioning our ability to compete effectively. It is in times like these that you can either go into zero productivity oscillation or take a deep breath, step back, look at the priorities and make sure through it all that you never lose focus on the most important aspect of our business – serving our customers – while the other needs are serviced adequately to keep the train running on the rails.
I am very fortunate to have a leadership team that supports me and each other quite well allowing for us to share the burden and to lift each other up if when the needs exceed one’s peak capacity to address. They lift me up when I am down and my New Year’s wish for all of you is that you have and remember the people that have “Packed your parachutes” over your careers. The "Packing your parachutes" story references an aviator, Charles Plumb, who was shot down in a war and one day several years later came to meet the person who packed his parachute that day he bailed out of his airplane. In part due to that chance meeting Plumb became a motivational speaker asking everyone to think about the people who may have helped each person's career by using the metaphor of "Packing your parachutes" and to pay that favor going forward for others.
When I look back at 2017, I see many things that I am proud of having been a part of like turning around the customer perception of Nokia at AT&T, to positioning ourselves to get the migrations going for our key customers to working with my team and my colleagues to enable this massive change within MN. One of the old adages that I am sure you have heard in the past is “The first part of tackling a problem is admitting that you have one.” Well, it is clear that we embraced the fact that future success can not be guaranteed by doing our MN business the same way we have done in the past. We have chosen a new direction with a foundation of Cloudified services based on 5G in preparation for one of the largest network infrastructure transformations in Wireless since the advent of digital cellular. Will this guarantee success? Not by itself, but it has the potential to be game changing as long as ….. we deliver to our customers with quality!
The lack of quality is the second problem that we admitted we were suffering from in MN. The tendency to cut corners increases when deliveries are late and the competitive pressures for time to market are rapidly increasing. Of course, deciding to deliver or not is all about measuring business risk however one truth repeats over and over again – failure to deliver quality HW and SW causes a loss of market share.
What would I have done differently in 2017? Well, since we were making progress on quality in Baseband I was a bit cautious of moving to the target model for MN very rapidly as opposed to progressing over a measured period of time. In retrospect, moving faster would have been better and this will be a major focus of our first leadership team meeting in 2018. Also, I could have been a better advocate for advancing quality initiatives more rapidly inside our business and driving more competitive benchmarking vs incremental improvement. Lessons learned.
So, enough about my perspectives on 2017. As is my custom, I’d like to share with you a few reflections from my library. And, for those of you who told me last year that you “Saw this one before” to which I responded that many Nokians were seeing them for the first time, I have decided to include both some new items as well as a few “classics."

First, from the “classic” repertoire, a short reflection on the changing dynamics of time in our lives which I try to remember every day but honestly find a hard time achieving the target balance intended. Definitely an opportunity for personal improvement in 2018.

TAKE TIME FOR TEN THINGS
TAKE TIME TO WORK - (it is the price of success)
TAKE TIME TO THINK - (it is the source of power)
TAKE TIME TO PLAY (it is the secret of youth)
TAKE TIME TO READ ( it is the foundation of knowledge)
TAKE TIME TO WORSHIP (it washes the dust of earth from our eyes)
TAKE TIME TO HELP AND ENJOY FRIENDS (it is the source of happiness)
TAKE TIME TO LOVE (it is the one sacrament of life)
TAKE TIME TO DREAM (it hitches the soul to the stars)
TAKE TIME TO LAUGH (it is the singing that helps with life's loads)
TAKE TIME TO PLAN (it is the secret of being able to have the time to take for the first nine things)

From the “new” list I’d like to introduce you to one of the people who brightens up the start of each week for me by gracing my inbox with an Inspirational message for the week. His name is Michael Reuter and I have saved some of his best snippets from all of his messages. Today, I’d like to share a few of them with you.

From 3 Minute Leadership Messages by Michael Reuter:
In his book, The Energy Bus, Jon Gordon shares his thoughts on ten rules he suggests that great leaders should follow to bring energy to their life, work and those whom they serve. In these rules, we find the call for personal ownership, vision, passion, enthusiasm, purpose and caring, a life in which every moment is filled with radiant positive energy - the source of energy, initiative and happiness.

10 RULES FOR THE RIDE OF YOUR LIFE
1. You’re the driver of your bus.
2. Desire, vision, and focus move your bus in the right direction.
3. Fuel your ride with positive energy.
4. Invite people on your bus and share your vision for the road ahead.
5. Don’t waste your energy on those who don’t get on your bus.
6. Post a sign that says “No Energy Vampires Allowed” on your bus.
7. Enthusiasm attracts more passengers and energizes them during the ride.
8. Love your passengers.
9. Drive with purpose.
10. Have fun and enjoy the ride.

From Zig Ziglar’s life and teachings – the following is beautifully captured in his words:
“Desire is what takes the hot water of mediocrity and turns it into the steam of outstanding success.”
"You cannot climb the ladder of success dressed in the costume of failure."
“We cannot start over, but we can begin now and make a new ending.”
“Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.”
"If you want to reach a goal, you must 'see the reaching' in your own mind before you actually arrive at your goal."
“There are no traffic jams on the extra mile.”
“Confidence is going after Moby Dick in a rowboat and taking tartar sauce with you.”

In his book, How Successful People Think, John Maxwell writes: “I’ve studied successful people for forty years and, though the diversity you find among them is astounding, I’ve found that they are all alike in one way: how they think. That is the one thing that separates successful people from unsuccessful ones.”

Maxwell shares his thoughts on the eleven skills, the key thinking ‘pieces’, that great leaders need if they are to achieve great things. His teaching focuses not on the ‘what’ to think, but on the ‘how’ to think with strong emphasis placed on all the pieces working together to make a magnificent symphony.

Seeing the wisdom of big-picture thinking
Unleashing the potential of focused thinking
Discovering the joy of creative thinking
Recognizing the importance of realistic thinking
Releasing the power of strategic thinking
Feeling the energy of possibility thinking
Embracing the lessons of reflective thinking
Questioning the acceptance of popular thinking
Encouraging the participation of shared thinking
Experiencing the satisfaction of unselfish thinking
Enjoying the return of bottom-line thinking

Here’s wishing all of you a THOUGHTFUL and ENJOYABLE 2018! CARPE DIEM! CARPE MERCATUM!

body.parsed:
Qingdao TC Future X Award - SGsFED Qingdao Team

SGsFED team successfully delivered to Verizon one high-performance and capacity-elastic solution Carina with creative ideas and achievements:
1. Submitted 2 patents aiming to expand the capability of SGsFED.
2. 7 GIM ideas accepted and 6 GIM ideas completed.
3. Firstly achieved cloud CPU vertical growth in our products.
4. Invented brand new SCTP module and promoted 7 times on throughput.
5. SGsFED created one moduled layered framework of front end distribution functionality  which can be reused for other interface.
6. Multiple perspective code inspection model is proposed and executed to enhance the code quality.

The handsome/beautiful team members are:
Alex Gao, Harry Han, Jessica Chen, Rainbow Zhang, Steven Zhao, Walle Kong, Wayne Wang, Felix Wang, Aleda Pang, Nancy Zhang, Thomas Wu

Thank all of you for earning money back from customer :)

And also extend great thanks to the following guys for their professional support to SGsFED project:
Albin Wang, Mike Edwards, John Gafrick, Casper Liu, Loorean Wang, Douglas Norman, John Jiang, Wallace Zhang, Jack Li, David Wang, Futang Wang, Benjamin Zhang, Chris Wan, Conan Gao.

attachments.content_excerpt:
Have you checked out the new left-shift quality learning experience? If not, I encourage you to do it now. This overview answers key questions like what proactive left-shift quality is all about and why it’s important. Then, it gives examples of left-shift in practice and discusses the behaviors needed at the squad level. I invite you to explore this virtual space where you can read, listen, watch and adopt. To get a sense of the interactive experience, scroll through the left-shift quality learning experience.

If you have any questions or need coaching, please contact Kumar, Maneesh 2. (Nokia - US/Naperville).

cc: Hebert, Monique (Nokia - US/Naperville), Song, Tony (Nokia - CN/Beijing), Schroepfer, Scott (Nokia - US/Naperville), Chauhan, Sunita (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Bailey, Marianne (Nokia - GB/Reading), Fasce, Sergio (Nokia - IT/Vimercate), Seifert, Kevin (Nokia - US/Naperville), Erlemeier, Joerg (Nokia - DE/Munich), Keibel, Astrid (Nokia - DE/Munich), Voege, Tim (Nokia - DE/Munich), Nielsen, Lisbeth (Nokia - DE/Munich), Tam, Jim (Nokia - CA/Ottawa), Nicosia, John (Nokia - US/Murray Hill), Lhospital, Jj (Nokia - US/Naperville), Roznovsky, John (Nokia - US/Naperville), Messer, Tilo (Nokia - DE/Munich), Rob Sherwood, PMP, Cox, Ian (Nokia - GB/Bristol), Hoover, Clinton (Nokia - US/Irving), Meekel, Jacques (Nokia - US/Murray Hill), Todorow, Tim (Nokia - US/Irving) https://sway.com/vQfYu5CsW5zBX9Bx

body.parsed:
Qingdao TC Future X Award - Retrospective meeting 2018 Q1

All assessors including tribe leaders, squad leaders&change leaders from different tribes in Qingdao TC had a retrospective meeting for 2018 Q1 Qingdao TC Future X Award today. 
Below are some comments and key points come out from the meeting and we want to share with all.

1.	Well time control otherwise you will be stopped.
2.	Keep your focus on the key message with the example and data to support your statement. 
3.	Deliver the key message concisely. In order to complete the presentation, we used to deliver the speech in a very fast speed. But somehow the output is not that satisfied. So we suggest you to do subtract(作减法) and focus on the key points rather than all the words. 
4.	How our achievement is correlated to the MN strategy? 
5.	Emphasize shining points of your project compare to others.
6.	Reuse potential is an important part. It’s better to have reuse showcase. 
7.     Think about higher level linkage(TC/cross TCs) or cross products linkage as your re-use showcase;
8.     Well prepare your slides with good practice and data supported and well preparation for presentation and Q/A.
9.     Back to basics, focus on your materials with official template when doing presentation.
10.   Be confident when presenting.

body.parsed:
Qingdao TC Future X Award sharing(Enabling DevOps (Team)) - NTAS Architect Qingdao Team
The NTAS Architect Qingdao Team(Tony Wang, Neil Nei and Ryan Liu) worked with Budapest team and Naperville team together to demonstrate a full continuous delivery scenario on bare-metal with vanilla Kubernetes to Verizon, and AT&T, and got very positive feedback from customers:
Teamwork: the three teams worked closely to achieve a same target including infrastructure design and setup, continuous delivery cases design and implementation, running NTAS on bare-metal and public cloud.

Customer Focus: acted quickly, and worked overtime to meet customer’s evolving requirements, and tight schedule, including installation NTAS on bare-metal in 1 week, build the CD infrastructure and implement the CD cases in 3 weeks, and etc.

Technical Leadership: showed strong technical leadership in NTAS and FOSS areas, and showed Nokia’s expertise and advance in DevOps and cloud native technologies.

body.parsed:
Qingdao TC Future X Award sharing - CC Productization TAS pst team.

Nokia TAS (NTAS) is the first Cloud native product of Nokia MN family,  NTAS QD squad group has been taking the full responsibility for 4 NTAS profiles (FMS, FCS, BCS and SCC) Product  System Testing (PST) and demonstrated great contribution from both delivery and quality perspectives.

Quality first – NTAS is an newly target portfolio product with embracing cloud/docker technology, CBIS/CBAM, new infrastructure, common dispatchers, new OAM architecture and merging fNokia and fALU TAS business logic. Driving each domain and whole system quality stabilization is big challenging. The PST team are taking the challenging to drive both individual container level and whole NTAS system level quality improvement with uncovering ~ 955 jiras in the 1st 17.0 release. All those findings has triggering R&D tribe taking actions for quality improvement in design, coding, dev. testing, SCM/CI, etc; The pst team also improved the testing coverage via learning from Robust Verification Index (RVI), cloud/docker native, learning from VzW, at&t, CMCC pilot testing, adding additional ~300 new provocative testing cases in 17.8 which already reported ~ 150 new jiras.

Team work – Along with the transformation from legacy IMS team to NTAS pst team, lots of good teamwork for team learning and sharing for new technology. US peers spent many evenings to share the business logic knowledge; During the testing, QD team have many jointly lab sessions with Naperville, Athens and Budapest teams for helping critical issues debugging and knowledge sharing;  Also QD pst team spent lots of extra time training local service team and NPI teams for them to support NFV pilot for CMCC, CTC , KPN, etc..

Break silos – In early integration, the process, testing environment are different between fALU pst team and fNokia dev. teams. The team take proactive actions to get related people from different locations with conference calls, jointly lab sessions to move the project forward in parallel with process harmonization;  During the NTAS (MN) and netACT (AA) integration, the team  got all the experts to Qingdao site together and made the integration and demo to VzW an big success!

Willing to take challenging: the pst team is willing to take the challenging for fully responsibility for 4 NTAS profiles delivery when transformed from legacy IMS product; When netACT and NTAS integration became an blocking issue for VzW fightback plan, the pst team was taking the leading role to drive the integration  with an big success;  When Budapest pst team need support for MCS 17.0 P8,  QD pst team are helping their pst testing with ~ 70 jiras reported and also go to VF India for supporting site!

body.parsed:
Wednesday on 1/17/2018, Nokia Qingdao Innovation Day was held in Qingdao Garage hall. Over hundreds of engineers that full of energy and creativity joined this innovation big event. Qingdao TC head, Ellen, and NTAS tribe leader, Klaus, paid great attention for this activity, and Klaus made an ebullience speech, sharing Qingdao's splendent invention heritage and encouraging us to be more enthusiasm in work. 

We are also honorable to invite Jonathan, N-2 for MN CC, and his team to show up in this event.

Eighteen teams from 10 product lines demonstrated their brilliant achievements covered IOT, Cloud, 5G, DevOps, CI and other hot technology in telecom field. Audiences were engaged by the enthusiastic atmosphere.

Jonathan set a high value for the innovation spirit and achievements. Innovation drives business, it is innovation that promote our creativity to satisfy customer demand. Jonathan said Qingdao is a very positive and bright team, and he believe that Qingdao will be more important and responsible in Nokia by this aggressive and enterprising spirit.

Winners were awarded after an impassioned competition, but more important is the innovation mindset inspiration broadcasting in this innovation day. It told us that we should keep Nokia Way, keep marching and keep transforming. Innovation will always be the lifeblood of our company.

cc: Li, Hui HL. (NSB - CN/Qingdao)

attachments.content_excerpt:
On Jan 16th, we were much honored to have Cloud Core DU head Jonathan Harvey, Operation&Transformation head Matthias Reiss and BHR head Madhu Bisht visit Qingdao and hold the town hall meeting with Qingdao Cloud Core engineers.

In the town hall, Jonathan clearly delivered Nokia Cloud Core strategy direction which includes AirGile Cloud-Native Core and Automated Operation &Cloud Agility. Jonathan also shared Cloud Core 2018 focus areas -- back to basics and portfolio evolution. Later Matthias emphasized Cloud Core transformation plan (Quality, Delivery(CI/CD), Serviceability&Operability, Market leadership and Automation).

Jonathan, Matthias and Madhu also recognized the team and individual who had the excellent showcases in accountable in delivery, quality first, enabling DevOps, leading changes and innovation GIM. At the end of the town hall, there were a lot of good questions raised. Jonathan very kindly shared his view, directions and insights with the team. The talk was open, informative and aspiring. All engineers appreciated the opportunity of face-to-face talk to our top leaders.

In dedicated meetings leaders of the Qingdao team shared insights in projects, transformation activities, accomplishment and challenging. Among all of these, Jonathan, Matthias and Madhu specifically recognized the "Can-Do" attitude and “Accountability” that Qingdao team has demonstrated, and they appreciated all of the sharing and help across teams without boundaries, which is excellent and more are needed across teams and sites…..

Qingdao team will definitely make relentless efforts to deliver better result in 2018.

cc: Harvey, Jonathan (Nokia - GB/Bristol), Reiss, Matthias (Nokia - DE/Munich), Bisht, Madhu (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), ZHAO, Grace J (Grace), ZHANG, Klaus (Klaus), Hinch, Tina (Nokia - US/Naperville), Cheminn Madruga, Marcelo (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Szatmari, Julia (Nokia - HU/Budapest)

Jonathan also shared Cloud Core 2018 focus areas -- back to basics and portfolio evolution. Later Matthias emphasized Cloud Core transformation plan (Quality, Delivery(CI/CD), Serviceability&Operability, Market leadership and Automation).

Jonathan, Matthias and Madhu also recognized the team and individual who had the excellent showcases in accountable in delivery, quality first, enabling DevOps, leading changes and innovation GIM. At the end of the town hall, there were a lot of good questions raised. Jonathan very kindly shared his view, directions and insights with the team. The talk was open, informative and aspiring. All engineers appreciated the opportunity of face-to-face talk to our top leaders.

In dedicated meetings leaders of the Qingdao team shared insights in projects, transformation activities, accomplishment and challenging. Among all of these, Jonathan, Matthias and Madhu specifically recognized the "Can-Do" attitude and “Accountability” that Qingdao team has demonstrated, and they appreciated all of the sharing and help across teams without boundaries, which is excellent and more are needed across teams and sites…..

Qingdao team will definitely make relentless efforts to deliver better result in 2018.

cc: Harvey, Jonathan (Nokia - GB/Bristol), Reiss, Matthias (Nokia - DE/Munich), Bisht, Madhu (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), ZHAO, Grace J (Grace), ZHANG, Klaus (Klaus), Hinch, Tina (Nokia - US/Naperville), Cheminn Madruga, Marcelo (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Szatmari, Julia (Nokia - HU/Budapest)

body.parsed:
Embrace the New Era - 2017 Nokia Qingdao Year-end Party 

On 10th Jan., 2018, Nokia Qingdao held 2017 annual town hall meeting and year-end party in Qingdao Ocean Spring Metropark Hotel. All employees in Shandong, from Nokia Qingdao, NSB Qingdao, Shandong sales, etc., joined this grand activity. Mike Wang, Maggie Ma and the other 6 EDGMs attended this annual event. 

Mike Wang, President of Nokia Shanghai Bell, made a speech at the party. He emphasized that Qingdao is a creative and passionate team. Mike shared with us what have been done in the last year and severe challenges we will meet in 2018. Mike demands everyone to act according to CEAD – Customer focus, Efficiency, Accountability and Discipline. He inspired all employees to do things with perseverance and flexibility. Then, 19 teams from Qingdao were recognized by Mike for great accomplishment in 2017. 

After the town hall meeting, over 100 actors and actress from all departments presented a brilliant party with drama, dancing and singing. The performances are all like fine works that indicate employees’ work or lives, and are topic prominent, humorous, creative and full of splendid confidence. At the end of the show, ‘A fire in the winter’ came on the stage and brought everyone to the zenith, which is from Mike and his famous Nokia Library Band. The hall was lighted by their passion and professionalism. This party is highly appraised by all attendees. 

The new year has been sailing with great expectation and hope. Let’s go hand in hand and shape our future together.

body.parsed: NTAS going to live for the first time
body.plain: NTAS going to live for the first time(1 Share attached)
body.rich: NTAS going to live for the first time

attachments.content_excerpt:
Vodafone India went live with our VoLTE solution today, providing VoLTE service to 10K subscribers at Mumbai and Gujarat! 4000 users have been provisioned so far. This is NTAS' first commercial launch! Kudos to the whole TAS R&D team for many months' of hard work and perseverance, and for the strong push the last couple of weeks. The path to this achievement was filled with challenges, but you all made it happen! While we have reached an important milestone, our journey has only just begun. More challenges await us as we continue to expand and harden the product, and broaden our customer base. Thank you for a job well done.

cc: Harvey, Jonathan (Nokia - GB/Bristol), Narayanaswamy, Sekhar (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), Silvennoinen, Katja (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Kim, Peter (Nokia - DE/Munich), Biston, Alain (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Kothari, Nilesh (Nokia - US/Naperville)

Dear CDS colleagues,

5 minutes to understand the very basics on how we should work in squads and how our programs will be organised in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework).

Listen to the 5 min video:
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MN_SAFe/Trainings/SitePages/Home.aspx

Team = Squad.

For more details, check out the basic SAFe learning already available in EDU (link on the same sharepoint page). We are now starting to adapt this framework to Mobile Networks.

All my best wishes to you and your teams for the New Year!

Berit

attachments.content_excerpt:
**ANNOUNCEMENT**

Nokia crypto-currency project goes public: https://www.monetasa.com

Monetasa is an eBay for IoT sensor data. But beyond IoT, Monetasa marketplace can be used to sell or buy any type of data,
independently of it’s type or provenance. Monetasa is distributed and decentralized system based on blockchain.
Blockchain technology is used for several important purposes in Monetasa system:

- To enable tokenization of value (i.e. provide TAS token) and token economy
- To insure data integrity (i.e. to store data hashes and guarantee that data is not tampered with)
- To enable Smart Contract capabilities
- To provide network security via PBFT consensus and immutability and make the system hack-proof

Read more about Monetasa system in the project's whitepaper: https://www.monetasa.com/monetasa_whitepaper.pdf

Monetasa (ex Blocksense) is Nokia DIA (Digital Innovation Accelerator) sponsored project.

cc: Saleh, George (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Novakovic, Dejan (Nokia - DE/Munich)

Nokia crypto-currency project goes public: https://www.monetasa.com

Monetasa is an eBay for IoT sensor data. But beyond IoT, Monetasa marketplace can be used to sell or buy any type of data,
independently of it’s type or provenance. Monetasa is distributed and decentralized system based on blockchain.
Blockchain technology is used for several important purposes in Monetasa system:

- To enable tokenization of value (i.e. provide TAS token) and token economy
- To insure data integrity (i.e. to store data hashes and guarantee that data is not tampered with)
- To enable Smart Contract capabilities
- To provide network security via PBFT consensus and immutability and make the system hack-proof

Read more about Monetasa system in the project's whitepaper: https://www.monetasa.com/monetasa_whitepaper.pdf

Monetasa (ex Blocksense) is Nokia DIA (Digital Innovation Accelerator) sponsored project.

cc: Saleh, George (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Novakovic, Dejan (Nokia - DE/Munich)

body.parsed:
MN Qingdao TC Scaled Agile Training and Good Practices Sharing

Around 32 members from MN Cloud Core and HetRAN-G joined Qingdao MN scaled agile training and good practices sharing on 28th and 29th of Dec 2017. The training includes two sessions, Spotify scaling agile practice and SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework).

In the first day of the training, the external famous agile coach Zhou Jingen introduced the practice of Spotify. By the direction of his gamification teaching methods, all the participants got and understood the spirit of the scaling agile of Spotify. That is “autonomy” and “alignment”. The team members are provided autonomy in terms of decision making based on the same objective and value stream. This kind of concept is highly consistent with our MN transformation idea. Everyone benefited a lot from the training of Spotify practice.

SAFe was derived from the former NOKIA and this is why it is very suitable for the huge telecommunication company. In the second day of the training, Li Jianhao, an expert of enterprise agility transformation, showed the basic knowledge of SAFe. It covered the four levels of SAFe (Team, Program, Solution and Portfolio), as well as some good practice cases from other companies. All we know that SAFe and the GIT tool technology have been chosen to support DevOps and Agile development in Mobile Networks. By the learning and sharing, it is believed that the participants can provide more productivity in the way of pushing SAFe and DevOps.

The Q&A sessions were interleaved in the whole 2 days’ training. A lot of questions from the participants were raised and discussed. Although not all the questions were clarified, comprehensive agile information were delivered under the heated discussion and everyone could get more close to the best practice which is fit for our corporation.

This is really an unforgettable and impressive training. We believe the participants can support their team members entering into a more agile organization in the near future.

cc: [[user:1639967320]], [[user:1639983272]], [[user:1639993032]], [[user:1639869576]], [[user:1639997752]], [[user:1639849062]]

body.parsed:
Dear Colleagues

2018 is here,
【MN CoDE Professor Comes】want to say thank you to all the outstanding professors in 2017！
Great thanks to the 14 professors who delivered 15 classroom and 7 hands-on courses last year
They are:
Tang Alan, Larry Guo, Stacy Fu, Matrix Wang, Turing Luo, Thomas Wu,  Conan Gao, 
Joanna Liu, Gifford Jiang, Steve Wang, Hank Liu, Tony Wang, Cloud Sun, Felix Wang

Thank you for preparing lessons meticulously. 
Thank you for delivering lectures vividly
Thank you for answering our questions patiently
Our gratitude to you for all you have done
You are our cute diligent gardeners~❤~

【MN CoDE Professor Comes】also want to give our best wishes to all our colleagues
Happy New Year!!!
On this New Year we wish that you have 
a wonderful January, a lovely February, a Peaceful March, a stress-free April, a fun-filled May, 
and Joy that lasts from June to November, and finally a happy December. 
May our wishes come true and may you have a charming and lucky New Year 2018.
Follow【Professor Comes】to learn more and grow yourselves in 2018~!

【MN CoDE Professor Comes】

Everyone enjoys this happy time and Merry Christmas to all of you!

body.parsed:
Mike Wang's morning tea - 12/18. Fight for the year-end result. 

Below is the poem of Nostagia to memorize Guangzhou Yu

Nostalgia 
-----by 余光中 
When I was a child, 
Nostalgia seemed a small stamp: 
"Here am I 
And there ……my mother." 

Then I was a grown-up, 
Nostalgia became a traveling ticket: 
"Here am I 
And there……my bride." 

During the later years, 
Nostalgia turned to be a graveyard: 
"Here am I 
And yonder……my mother." 

And now at present, 
Nostalgia looms large to be a channel: 
"Here am I 
And yonder……my Continent!"

body.parsed:
Yes, MN requries every employee should allocate 2 hours/week on learning.  

Question:  Why we should have 92 points per year?
Answer:  52 weeks per year minus holidays (public + private) = 46 working weeks .

1 learning hour = 1 point.
46 weeks *2 hours/week = 92 points/year 

e.g. if someone's learning hours are 111 hours, then his learning index will be 111/92 * 100% = 120%.

body.parsed: On December 6th, QD NIDD team successfully delivered the Fast Pass metadata import programmatic interfaces to all NE teams. These interfaces cover the key import and creation functions of CM, FM, PM and AoM fragments. With one year's hard work, QD NIDD Team has been continuously delivering the following Fast Pass Features with high quality: FMC, AoMCap, AoMPMB, Change Notification, SWAM, NBI: BulkCM, NBI3GCFM and FM Adaptation. The implementation of these programmatic interfaces will enable the fully automation of Fast Pass Continuous Integration System.

Hi All,

Many thanks for your great participating in the 2nd Change Map Survey. The final participation rate for MN Qingdao is 98%. This is an excellent response rate and thanks for the great input and feedback. 

The initial view indicates that the Change Map position we landed on is 'Battling It Out', vs “Yes, but” in the last Change Map Survey. For your information please find attached the initial, high-level Qingdao survey report. 

Over the next few weeks we will run deep dives and reviews of the survey results to generating different level actions plans with global/local tribe change leaders. If you have any feedback or comments, please let me know. 

Thanks
Ellen

body.parsed:
You all 6 are doing exactly what matters : cooperation inside the company, removing silos. Competition against each other for InnoPoints is behind us, now starts tghe era of cooperaion and mutualised innovation, and you all 6 are leading the pack !
That now gives ou the honor and responsibility to share with other InnoMasters what best practices you have decided to enforce.
Beyond you 6, there are also plenty of other smart cooperations to build up with other Locations and TC. For instance in IoT, in smart cities, in autonomous cars and smart traznsport, in e-health,.... You now understand how to bring together pieces of potential innovation (not and easy task), you may start to understand what pieces are missing to your global picture, so make a RFP, a call for action to rest of Nokia !

body.parsed: The lastest Virtual Zero requirements on FNR (fault not reproducible)
body.plain: The lastest Virtual Zero requirements on FNR (fault not reproducible)(1 Share attached)
body.rich: The lastest Virtual Zero requirements on FNR (fault not reproducible)

attachments.content_excerpt:
Important changes have been made to the Virtual Zero requirements to improve delivered software quality by minimizing the opportunities for customer experienced defects. The following rules are to be applied to all programs effective immediately.

Fault Not Reproducible (FNR)

Fault Not Reproducible (FNR) / One time occurrence fault is any SW/HW fault which is not reproducible in the labs. In this case additional analysis of available logs does not enable root cause identification or lead to fault correction.

FNR/One time occurrence faults can be excluded from the release Virtual Zero count.

If the fault re-occurs a second time, it cannot be treated as FNR anymore and must be included in the VZ count.

Conditions

1. FNR is applicable only for B and C class faults found in R&D, CST, or Customer Environment.
2. FNR/One time occurrence of the fault must be confirmed with the tester who originally reported the fault.
3. Minimum monitoring period before fault can be categorized as FNR is 14 days from the first report date.
4. An aggressive attempt to reproduce and find root cause must be completed (Number of attempts, number of configurations checked, varied traffic loads, etc. )
5. FNR backlog must be managed at < 5 to guard against an unstable release and technical debt. Periodic RCA/EDA of FNR root causes must be completed to trigger continuous improvement actions to further improve quality.
6. No reoccurrence must to be demonstrated by creation and closure of the Correction Form with FNR suffix to the build where the problem doesn’t occur. Correction form to be set to Ready For Testing adding required testing levels. The problem report author needs to retest the original scenario and can close the correction form if problem doesn't occur in the build anymore.

The Virtual Zero program has been embedded as part of the CREATE process and is a standard process across Nokia. These updates will be included the Virtual Zero Counting Rules guideline version 4.2 that will be published in the MN CREATE January 2018 Release.

If the fault re-occurs a second time, it cannot be treated as FNR anymore and must be included in the VZ count.

Conditions

2. FNR/One time occurrence of the fault must be confirmed with the tester who originally reported the fault.
3. Minimum monitoring period before fault can be categorized as FNR is 14 days from the first report date.
4. An aggressive attempt to reproduce and find root cause must be completed (Number of attempts, number of configurations checked, varied traffic loads, etc. )
5. FNR backlog must be managed at < 5 to guard against an unstable release and technical debt. Periodic RCA/EDA of FNR root causes must be completed to trigger continuous improvement actions to further improve quality.

The Virtual Zero program has been embedded as part of the CREATE process and is a standard process across Nokia. These updates will be included the Virtual Zero Counting Rules guideline version 4.2 that will be published in the MN CREATE January 2018 Release.

cc: Du, L (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Mai, Maggie (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Xie, Crystal 1. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Wang, Richard A. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), DOU, Brady (Brady)

attachments.content_excerpt:
2017 Qingdao Get 1 hour back summary
The following five things we’ve done to gain the time back in 2017
* Setup virtual team as ambassadors who came from each BG AA/FN/MN/GSM to promote Get 1H back activity.
* Shortened the meeting duration and reduced the non-value meetings; Put the poster and feedback in the meeting room to enhance awareness of “Effective Meeting”; Designed the voting box on meeting room’s door to collect the meeting efficiency feedback in real-time.
* Introduced Jabber to facilitate the team members’ communication with IT support , worked out and deployed Pidgin for Jabber before day1.
* O365 for co-creation.
* Made the survey for pain point and improved lunch operation/meeting room system with WR support. Leaders/Managers conducted self-evaluation (via mini-survey) and adjusted the frequency/style/logistics. Upgraded the lunch operation from manual tickets to POS machine ,freed up all available meeting rooms and upgraded QD meeting room reservation system to improve employees’ satisfaction.

2018 Plan – Will focus on promoting get 1H back tips and module in the sharefolder with “build your day” activity, also will collect/recognize the best practice with Get 1 H back award. In addition, make the survey for pain point and lead the improvement accordingly. The detailed plan is still under discussion and will be finalized soon.

body.parsed:
Mike Wang's morning tea -- 12/4. Sorry for late. The following 5 statements are shared in Mike's talk. The company promotes the endless learning culture, which is exactly echo #3.   

1、一杯清水因滴入一滴污水而变污浊，一杯污水却不会因一滴清水的存在而变清澈。
   2、这世上有三样东西是别人抢不走的：一是吃进胃里的食物，二是藏在心中的梦想，三是读进大脑的书。
   3、如果不读书，行万里路也不过是个邮差。
   4、马在松软的土地上易失蹄，人在甜言蜜语中易摔跤。
   5、世界没有悲剧和喜剧之分，如果你能从悲剧中走出来，那就是喜剧，如果你沉缅于喜剧之中，那它就是悲剧

attachments.content_excerpt:
Hi, I am glad to share with you all that I have been recently certified as a Lean Six Sigma Green Belt in Nokia. I am part of the 3GCm-MRD Qingdao team and my project was to improve mNGN SGW-IWF 9381 Continuous Integration Efficiency. The project reduced CI cycle time duration: 2~3 hours averagely per 9381load builds. This saved Nokia 93.7K€ in operational savings.
The details of my project can be found at:https://c.na37.visual.force.com/apex/QIPPProjectDetailView?id=a180P00000jVMVoQAO&retURL=https%3A%2F%2Fc.na37.visual.force.com%2F

attachments.title: Message from Marc Rouanne: Fine-tuning our organization to ensure people are working in the areas that matter the most
attachments.content_excerpt:
Dear colleagues,

We are in the midst of a continuous transformation, which we kicked off in May. As part of this transformation we recently launched our new organizational set-up to establish an architecture-driven organization - fast and agile in execution. I am pleased to see what has been accomplished so far: we now have 240 tribes and approximately 3000 squads in place, which are all adapting their ways of working to our new R&D blueprint and our new operational model. We are working with greater speed, and this is down to your hard work.

Now is the right time to continue our transformation by focusing on further simplification, co-location and defragmentation. The aim is to set up teams with the right people at the right place to make sure they are working on strategically important technologies in high-priority areas. This will mean that squad and tribe members can work in the most efficient, agile and rapid manner. To accomplish this, a number of individual employees or even entire squads are planned to be transferred to other squad groups, tribes, Development Units or Functions. Approximately 2000 employees are in the scope of the planned changes. In majority of the reassignment cases the receiving organization is either 5G RAN, ATF or Cloud Solutions. We will see, among others, Commercial Management and Business Digitalization and ATF re-organizing their set-ups for further simplification and streamlining. The related changes are expected to become effective as of December 11, subject to engagement of employee representatives in line with local legal processes and practices, where needed. Your line manager will share the details with you if you are impacted by these reassignment or re-organization efforts.

Why do we do these reassignments and re-organizations? MN continues to invest in 5G and Cloud and is broadening its focus into multiple areas of early 5G mobility use cases. This focus may require a shift of resources to strengthen the related development teams. We are constantly assessing where to invest as we need to be able to quickly react to changing customer needs and market conditions. These planned reassignments and re-organizations are the result of our quarterly investment reviews. They will give us the opportunity to learn new things and to broaden our experience and capabilities by working in important areas of the business. We plan to continue our transformation in quarterly waves, both to address organizational enhancements as well as to rotate people to work where it matters the most.

I am convinced that these initiatives will help us to improve efficiency and strengthen our bottom line to create the right internal environment for long-term sustainable growth.

Our aim is to create a modern, and motivational experience for our R&D engineers to innovate efficiently in the areas outlined by our strategy, and to do so with a quality-first mindset. A common toolset is key in this context. We recently announced (https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/#/Threads/show?threadId=982406938) that we have chosen Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and the GIT tool technology to support DevOps and Agile development in Mobile Networks. SAFe is an overall agile development framework that will help to bridge our processes from business management and development to agile continuous delivery. It’s a great way to scale large projects in large organizations. The GIT framework will be an integral part of our common toolset for software configuration management with the decision to go towards GERRIT for radio and GITLAB for other parts.

Going forward let me ask you to do four things to support these efforts:
First, keep your Delve profile up to date to help others to find you: Delve should be the first location you use to find a colleague. Delve will be our main people resource, and to make the most of it, I strongly encourage you to upload your skills and the projects that you have worked on onto Delve. Transparency will help us share knowledge and make decisions faster. If people can see what you know, and what you have worked on, not only will it save time hunting for the right colleague to speak with, it will also make it easier for you to work on interesting new projects in the future.

Second, take the next 1 in 90 conversation with your line manager as an opportunity to discuss your personal career aspirations. These reassignments offer great opportunities for personal development and you can proactively discuss a potential reassignment with your line manager if you wish to broaden your expertise.

Third, check out and bookmark the MN Intranet site (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/MN/) and MN Transformation site (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MN_Transformation/SitePages/Home.aspx) where you can find a one stop shop for MN, and MN transformation-related information, and get engaged in the discussions on the MN all Yammer forum (https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=7138094&view=all).

Finally, if you have not yet participated in the second round of the Change Map survey (https://survey.changetracking.com/survey/nokia/mn-all/dec-2017) do take the time to fill-out the questionnaire. Your opinion matters, and I am eager to get feedback from MN squads and tribes what they think on our transformation. The survey results will be shared MN-wide in January, and they will be our compass - helping us to decide what to focus on next in our transformation journey.

Marc

For further material: MN Transformation team site (http://nok.it/IfsjqY)

body.parsed:
Qingdao TC Future X Award

Dear colleagues,

This is the kick off message for the upcoming Future X Award in Qingdao TC. Future X Award program is to recognize the good examples of teams or individuals by providing a showcase at quality first, on time delivery, lead change and enabling DevOps with excellent Teamwork/Accountability/Change mindset/Continuous improvement.

There will be four award categories as follows:

-    Teaming for quality first (Team) 
-    We encourage teams who embrace quality in daily execution, focus on quality as the first priority and bring very positive business impact with good team work, dare to break silos , and be willing to take challenge.
-    Accountability for delivery (Team or individual) 
-    We highly promote the teams or individuals who show strong accountability for what they commit from the beginning to the end, taking end to end ownership even in very challenging situations, and make sure the commitment is fulfilled during the delivery.
-    Leading for change (Individual) 
-    We recognize the leaders who lead with clear vision and direction, show strong leadership in change, and drive for high performance. We praise Open Leadership that support Teamwork/Accountability/Clarity & Transparency, and those who act on them firmly.
-    Enabling DevOps (Team) 
-    We invigorate teams who can actively enable DevOps capability with obvious improvement on continuous integration, continuous delivery and continuous deployment. 

Future X Award nomination/election will be held quarterly and the first round will be performed during December to January timeframe. 
-    Case could come for whole year of 2017
-    Call for candidate submission: 12/4 – 12/29
-    TC Review/Assessment: 1/1 – 1/12 (2018)
-    TC Announcement & nomination to MNC done: 1/12 (2018)

Please use this template for your case submission and upload your cases in related folders. For detailed assessment rules, Please check the detailed information here. 


Your engagement will be highly appreciated and encouraged. 

Best regards,
Qingdao TC Office

- We highly promote the teams or individuals who show strong accountability for what they commit from the beginning to the end, taking end to end ownership even in very challenging situations, and make sure the commitment is fulfilled during the delivery.
- Leading for change (Individual)
- We recognize the leaders who lead with clear vision and direction, show strong leadership in change, and drive for high performance. We praise Open Leadership that support Teamwork/Accountability/Clarity & Transparency, and those who act on them firmly.
- Enabling DevOps (Team)
- We invigorate teams who can actively enable DevOps capability with obvious improvement on continuous integration, continuous delivery and continuous deployment.

Future X Award nomination/election will be held quarterly and the first round will be performed during December to January timeframe.
- Case could come for whole year of 2017
- Call for candidate submission: 12/4 – 12/29
- TC Review/Assessment: 1/1 – 1/12 (2018)
- TC Announcement & nomination to MNC done: 1/12 (2018)

Please use this template for your case submission and upload your cases in related folders. For detailed assessment rules, Please check the detailed information here.


Your engagement will be highly appreciated and encouraged.

Best regards,
Qingdao TC Office

messages.content_excerpt:

Dear colleagues,

This is the kick off message for the upcoming Future X Award in Qingdao TC. Future X Award program is to recognize the good examples of teams or individuals by providing a showcase at quality first, on time delivery, lead change and enabling DevOps with excellent Teamwork/Accountability/Change mindset/Continuous improvement.

There will be four award categories as follows:

- Teaming for quality first (Team)
- We encourage teams who embrace quality in daily execution, focus on quality as the first priority and bring very positive business impact with good team work, dare to break silos , and be willing to take challenge.
- Accountability for delivery (Team or individual)
- We highly promote the teams or individuals who show strong accountability for what they commit from the beginning to the end, taking end to end ownership even in very challenging situations, and make sure the commitment is fulfilled during the delivery.
- Leading for change (Individual)
- We recognize the leaders who lead with clear vision and direction, show strong leadership in change, and drive for high performance. We praise Open Leadership that support Teamwork/Accountability/Clarity & Transparency, and those who act on them firmly.
- Enabling DevOps (Team)

Future X Award nomination/election will be held quarterly and the first round will be performed during December to January timeframe.

attachments.content_excerpt:
We have made a big step in the promotion of DIA to all our colleagues by visiting 5 China TCs (Beijing, Shanghai, Nanjing, Qingdao and Hangzhou). I am very grateful to all the colleagues in the TCs who enabled this for me, and you could see some impressions posted previously by the TC colleagues on Yammer that I will not repeat. It was important for me and DIA program to be there due to importance of China market itself, but also due to innovation and business opportunities it brings. With the current pace of development, it is not wrong to say that China might become a new Silicon Valley, as some of the leading VCs are already predicting. Imagine the number of high quality engineers only in Nokia, but also in general in China and the market opportunity to scale all great new products first on domestic China market and then to scale it globally. Actually, the most successful, so called digital giants from China (Tencent, Baidu and Alibaba) are also doing the same. On top of this, on the recent top 10 most valued startups list from Wall Street Journal, there are four coming from China. The first place is still reserved for Uber valued >60BUSD, but the second position is reserved for Didi Chuxing valued already at 50BUSD. You can see the up-to-dated list here: http://graphics.wsj.com/billion-dollar-club/ . I am quite sure that next year there will be even more. One very important topic for DIA is artificial intelligence and machine and deep learning. We already fund some projects related to this. This is also where the importance of China is growing. Its government is planning to invest hundreds of billions of yuan (tens of billions of euros) into technology in coming years and companies are investing heavily in nurturing and developing related talents. Even one of MIT magazines wrote about this recently. History teaches us that usually this kind of China wide efforts usually succeed (remember high speed trains or telecommunications from the past, just to name a few) and this could make very soon China a leading force in AI. This plan wants homegrown AI to match that of in the US within three years, then China to make “major breakthroughs” by 2025 and China to be the AI leader in the world by 2030. Even now, China has some big advantages in AI – great base of talented engineers, but also data richness necessary to train AI systems and algorithms. Large amount of data makes a large amount of difference. I can only hope that Nokia will take also the advantage of these trends (respecting always Nokia ethical and data privacy standards, of course). As one of the great names in AI Andrew Ng said, “when you see technology trends shift, you had better move quickly, or someone else will beat you”. This is the btw the key for DIA – move quickly and test as many as new ideas as possible and either fail fast or be successful fast (in AI or in any other business area).
Besides having open discussion in town hall with many colleagues and many questions on DIA, I was also very excited to see that DIA video is running on internal displays and that DIA posters are all over the buildings in the TCs :-). I was impressed with the quality and maturity of business proposals and competencies of our colleagues in China. I already mentioned AI as an important topic, but my mind was “blown away” when I saw what a great AI/ML competence we have with some of the colleagues, I met during these days. We also reviewed with TC leadership teams and innoboards / garages some very exciting business ideas proposals that will soon enter the DIA funnel. As China is such a big market, if we would be able to make new business based on these ideas, the impact could be huge. We also discussed with TC leadership teams, innoboards / garages that they can support DIA in China as a local mentor or “sparring partner” for potential DIA intrapreneurs. I was also stressing the new role of ATF organization (where DIA program belongs) as the key owner of architecture and technology creation for MN. We also agreed that we will jointly organize hackathons or brainathons in the near future on the business challenges we will together agree. Furthermore, in Beijing I also had a good meeting with the colleagues organizing IQ quality workshops that I mentioned in one of my previous posts, and we agreed that innovations resulting from these workshops will be applied to DIA program. This way we will make sure that all great possible business ideas or innovation will have the chance to be implemented by the idea owners, if they wish to do so. Last, but not least we had our DIA presentation on Hangzhou innovation day.
I also have to say that I am great admirer of China‘s culture and heritage. Due to that fact, but not only because of that, I wanted to explain the DIA story using Chinese proverbs as much as possible. I would like to share this also with you all in this Yammer post. So, let’s start the DIA journey with the help of Chinese proverbs.
1. “Not having heard something is not as good as having heard it; having heard it is not as good as having seen it; having seen it is not as good as knowing it; knowing it is not as good as putting it into practice.” This is what we want to do in DIA, we want to put all the great knowledge that we have in our company and great ideas into practice, we do not want to keep the great innovations or ideas not implemented due to whatever challenges we might have in the company. Only when we start to implement something, we will face all the challenges and test whether the business idea will work or not. And we want to be fast in this i.e. test and then either fail fast or succeed and move fast and gain the market, as I already said above.
2. “Reading ten thousand books is not as useful as travelling ten thousand miles”. We want that our employees participating in DIA program develop themselves, develop business and entrepreneurial skills and have business ownership. They can do this the best, if they are challenged with all the problems they will encounter in running and growing their internal startups. This might be like a full MBA type of experience with the key difference that all the skills and knowledge are tested and applied immediately in practice. This is one of the key reasons why we have DIA program from our employees benefit point of view.
3. "If you want one year of prosperity, grow grain. If you want 10 years of prosperity, grow trees. If you want 100 years of prosperity, grow people”. We hope that the great benefit for Nokia from DIA is that we will generate new and growing businesses for Nokia. Therefore, we want to give the chance to our people to do this and through their own personal development, enable the growth of Nokia. This could be one contribution to help us make Nokia the best workplace in the world and the best employer of choice, especially for fresh university graduates.
4. "The emperor is rich, but he cannot buy one extra year“. If somebody had a great business idea, perhaps one of the reasons in the past why this was not implemented was that he did not have money or resources to do so. This is not anymore, an “excuse”, as if one wants to implement own business idea, now there is a chance with internal MN Venture Capital – DIA program.
5. “Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself”. When developing and executing the internal startup business, the employee (intrapreneur) is not left alone to execute. From his application to the program to the end of the startup and potential successful transfer to normal business, the intrapreneur is coached by the DIA coach and DIA concierge team who helps him/her with all possible issues e.g. preparing the funding pitch, ordering materials or developers’ work, establishing contact with sales teams, legal, HR, F&C etc.. Our intention is to make our intrapreneur successful by providing all this help. And this is not normally available in the external startup world.
6. “When there is a will, there is a way”. Our key requirement is that intrapreneurs think about real customer problems, real pain points for whoever might be the customer. The reason for this is that in one external startup study about why startups failed, 42% of respondents answered that the main reason was no market for their product. Therefore, we believe if we identify the right problem and huge pain point for potential customer and solve it with our solution, there is a way to execute through all possible ups and downs in a startup lifecycle. And, we want that our intrapreneurs think big when looking for the pain points and their solutions.
7. “Failure is the mother of success”. We touched this point many times so far and this is kind of a mantra in S. Valley that it is not problem to fail with your startup, if you did all what it takes to try to make it successful. As T. Edison said: “I haven’t fail. I just found 10000 ways that won’t work”.
8. “Talk doesn’t cook the rice”. This is related to our key requirement that we are not only interested in ideas of our colleagues, but we want to have the colleagues joining DIA with the business idea, but also willingness and ability to execute this idea. This is the key for the success of this program. We believe that idea is just 1%, while persistence is 99% (although it is true that if the idea is not good enough, the rest will probably not bring much).
As said at the beginning, China is already now a great (external) startup location and will be even more in the coming years. We need to ensure we benefit from the great talents we have with our colleagues in China and the great opportunities coming from this great country. I am really looking to see many new internal startups from China TCs and great future businesses and success for all of us in China and globally. It is important to highlight again: “When there is a will, there is a way”.

attachments.title: Location Share and Connect – Innovation Award Best Practices session 28/11: Resources, recording now available
attachments.content_excerpt:
Many thanks to our speakers:
- Oulu, Finland - Jussi Sarkka : Nokia Oulu, Home of Radio, « Think big, think new »
- Qingdao, China: Park Yang: Structured process, with monthly, quarterly, yearly cycles, to recognize all ideas, and reward the best ones
- Timisoara, Romania - Leon-Cosmin Lupu: Gamified “Let’s Challenge” innovation program

The Webex recording is now available here (https://nokiameetings.webex.com/nokiameetings/ldr.php?RCID=786ab8fb3cdec8fe4ab34cd39bec95e9).
Thanks to the anonymous artist who provided some modern art for the white board during our introduction. 😉

The presentations are available in our Location Share and Connect Best Practices Library:
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/LocationDevelopmentInformationHub/Best%20Practice%20Sharing/Best%20Practice%20Sharing.aspx?RootFolder=%2Fsites%2FLocationDevelopmentInformationHub%2FLocation%20Share%20Connect%20Record%2FAwards%5FBest%5FPractices%5F%2D%5FINNOVATION%5FCOMMUNITY%5F2017NOV28&FolderCTID=0x01200055424FA3E64E2A4CA9B605C3066E4FF1&View=%7BEFE02DAE%2D3A87%2D4D6F%2D9D04%2DC8F9866E3B1E%7D
You will also find here the video link mentioned by Jussi during his portion of the presentation.

Several people were interested in the Gamification technique used by the Timisoara site to reward innovation development with Nokia goodies. Cosmin Lupu shared some practical resources in Yammer so you can easily try this technique to motivate your ideators:
https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/threads/990691167

See you tomorrow for our next session, on Visionary Ambition and Execution Excellence.

cc: Yang, Park (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Jussi Särkkä, Lupu, Leon-Cosmin (Nokia - RO/Timisoara), Belud, Jean-Paul (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Piipponen, Niina (Nokia - FI/Espoo)

attachments.content_excerpt:
Spotify Map Game in MSS&MGW QD!

I think all of you are attracted by the video of Spotify Engineering Culture.

In order to help the teams to groom the scenarios and knowledges of the video, we designed a game (Spotify MAP)and invited MSS&MGW QD squads to expore the Spotify Tour together.

Totally, 33 scenario/knowdge about agile culture and pracitces are inolved in the Game. The Game helped team memebers to understand those agile culture and pracitces well. And it also encourage teamwork, communication and self organizing in the Game.

The feedback looks excellent. It is great to see all guys had a fun tour in the Game.

cc: Mai, Maggie (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Wang, Matrix (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Jeffrey Yu, Sun, Yan Sarah (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Yin, Tommy (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Zhang, Klaus (NSB - CN/Qingdao)
