attachments.title: A message from Marc Rouanne: Your voice matters - participate in the Change Map survey
attachments.content_excerpt:
Dear colleagues,

In May we started our continuous transformation. In October, we established our new organizational set-up based on squads and tribes helping us to become faster and much more agile in execution. Now we want to have your opinion on where you think we are with our transformation.

The 2nd round of the Mobile Networks Change Map survey starts on November 29th. Participate and you can help us identify the right actions to establish a culture of high performance in everything we do. The survey results will provide us with a baseline from which we can target our efforts and our focus areas for the coming months at all levels of Mobile Networks.

It will take you 15 to 20 minutes to complete the web-based Change Map questionnaire. Participation in this survey is anonymous. All individual responses are strictly confidential and reported anonymously and in aggregate to MN on squad group/team, tribe and unit level. Based on the results, we will be able to respond appropriately to issues and concerns and develop an action plan for improvement together with you.

The survey opens tomorrow and will be accessible until December 13th. You will receive the survey link via email from the MN Communication mailbox and it will be posted in the MN Yammer group as well.

If you have questions about the survey and the process, please contact Johanna Kivioja (http://). Technical support is available via the “Support” links in the survey tool itself. Do not forget to check Yammer posts with #mnchangemap (https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/#/Threads/Search?search=%23mnchangemap)!

Your input is important for the successful transformation of MN.

Thank you for taking the time to participate in this survey!

Best regards,
Marc

attachments.content_excerpt:
Thanks Novakovic, Dejan (Nokia - DE/Munich) for visiting Qingdao Site.

During the 2 days, he successfully delivered DIA's principle to all the staff. qd-inno-core proposed about 15 ideas to review. All of the idea owners have got valuable feedback. It is very helpful for the owners to know how to make the ideas better.

Besides, some ideas are using some common technologies, such as AI. It is good to set up a group of people to study together. Garage can also help to contact the experts from the Universities for consulting if needed. Garage aims to help all the ideas to be success.

To sum up, innovation is the future of the company. We believe we can make it better and better.

body.parsed:
【Qingdao TC News】2017 Nokia QD WLN Charity Bazaar @Qingdao TC   

2017 Nokia QD WLN charity bazaar was successfully held during 13th through 16th November. Nokia people in Qingdao enthusiastically supported this bazaar and demonstrated our strong social responsibilities as always. From individuals to groups, we were touched a lot by people’s warm heart and true love day by day. Different from previous bazaar activities, this activity adopted a brand-new model. We called for people to donate the unused goods to charity bazaar to dedicate their love. Some colleagues in the activity donated a lot of items in several times. Some colleagues gave a generous donation of totally new gift they just received. Some donated cash directly to bazaar and just took the small items symbolically. Some bought a bunch of items to support the bazaar. Qingdao TC organization bought most of the card bags. The first branch of Qingdao Mobile Network bought large quantities of succulent plants. No matter the size, every donation to the charity bazaar shows our selfless love to the children to be donated. During this charity bazaar, we raised money of total 3,325 RMB, and additionally WLN donated 6,675 RMB. WLN team will use the 10,000 RMB donation to purchase daily necessities for the disabled children in social welfare homes. We will keep all updated with later messages.

Now it’s close to end of 2017. In this year, we held the Women’s day celebration party, office yoga, and series of life and health related topic presentations, renovated the mother-and-baby room and held the ICT activity together with the China Ocean University. With WLN team's vision, we care for the women and even all employees in company, help employees grow and help employees perform the social responsibilities.

2017 Qingdao TC "Best Improvement Project" Award activity is in progress, highly encourage you to support us, visit our yammer page for QD WLN team via below link, and give your “LIKE” to us. You will see our exciting pictures and video there. 
https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/threads/982114427

attachments.content_excerpt:
2017 Qingdao TC "Best Improvement Project" Award – We Care, We Share, We Help, We Learn and We Grow together!

Qingdao WLN ( Women Leadership Team), we keep building the open, trustful, diverse and caring environment, promoting and supporting females' (all team members') professional skills and leadership growth.

In year 2017, we have conducted following activities and we hope to build the environment, and let our colleagues feel company is our 2nd home, stay comfortable, health and enjoy the work life here.

- Women's Day Celebration
- Girls in ICT
- Office Yoga
- <SHLG Program> We Share, We Help, We Learn and We Grow together.
SessionsI: 婴幼儿常见病讲座
Session II: 办公室亚健康的防治
- 母婴室选址改造 with WR team's great support
- <Our Future will be Better> School Activities
- Social activity: 慈善捐赠义卖 - Donation for child without parents.

body.rich: The draft Squad and Tribe metric. It is supposed to be automated metrics which shall reduce the reporting overburden and more focus on the improvement areas.

attachments.content_excerpt:
Hello,

Please find below the current working version of the Squad and Tribe Metrics.

In the renewed spirit of openness and transparency MN is aspiring to, the Metric Definition team has decided to share regularly the current state of work.
With this, we can get feedback and incorporate that into the work. We hope to tap into our collective crowd wisdom!

PLEASE NOTE:
1. This is work in progress and not the final set of proposed metrics.
2. Many of you will be shocked with the amount of metrics. You should take comfort in knowing that only fully automated metrics will be followed. The aim is not to overburden anyone with metric reporting.
3. The objective of having these metrics is to help Squads and Tribes know in which areas they can improve and how they compare with others inside Nokia and the Industry at large
4. Not all metrics are relevant to all Squads and Tribes. https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/mntribesandsquadsperformancemetricsautomationproject/_layouts/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B86B0F6C9-D784-4546-B45F-B0ED2100D9A3%7D&file=Objective_metrics_v5.xlsx&action=default

body.parsed:
以旧换“心”，爱如骄阳 - 青岛Nokia WLN 慈善募捐义卖活动圆满落幕
2017 Nokia QD WLN大型慈善募捐及义卖活动圆满结束，本次慈善募捐义卖活动得到了咱们青岛诺基亚人的热情支持，体现了我们一贯的高度社会责任感。活动中感人画面是一幕接一幕，从个人到团体组织，我们一路被暖暖的爱心感动着！与以往义卖活动不同的是，本次活动采用了以旧换“心”的募捐加义卖相结合的崭新模式，号召大家捐赠闲置物品奉献爱心，活动中有的同事捐赠了很多物品，看到义卖又再次捐赠，有的同事把刚到手的全新礼物慷慨捐赠，有的同事在义卖现场直接捐赠现金只是象征性地拿走了小小的物品，有的同事支持义卖买走了一堆物品，青岛TC组织爱心采购了义卖的大部分爱心卡套，青岛移动网络第一党支部爱心采购了义卖的大批量多肉植物，支持慈善之心不在大小，大家的每一份付出都是对捐助的孩子们无私的爱！本次慈善义卖活动共募捐善款3325元，另WLN捐赠6675元，WLN团队将用这一万元善款采购物品捐助社会福利院的残疾儿童们，把大家的爱心传递出去。敬请期待后续报道…

QD WLN团队2017年的活动接近尾声，2017年里我们举办了三八节活动、办公室瑜伽、生活健康系列讲座、母婴室改造以及携手海大开展了国际信息通信年轻女性日活动。秉持着团队的愿景，我们一直致力于关爱公司女员工乃至所有员工、帮助员工成长、帮助员工回馈社会。

2017 Qingdao TC “Best Improvement Project” Award活动正如火如荼进行中，特别邀请您打开下面链接访问Nokia QD WLN团队的yammer页面，点击“LIKE”为我们点赞！诚恳地感谢您的每一票！https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/threads/982114427

body.parsed:
2017 QD 5-10-15-20 Anniversary Celebration

On November 10th, 2017 anniversary celebration was held by HJT at Golf dining hall, nearly 70 members who joined this company for 5/10/15/20 years attended these ceremony.
 
Members entered the dining hall in a harmonious atmosphere, everyone marveled at how time flies and enjoyed the video with everyone’s photo and feeling for past five years.

The celebration started with a “Time travel fashion show” performed by the members from anniversary. The black Lucent jacket and Lucent sweater bring everyone back to the beginning of our company, to the days of fighting in the USA. And the lab coat and multi-function hand bag show our company spirit of pragmatism. Time passed by, our style become more fashionable. The colorful sportswear, polo shirt, and T shirt with department logo and slogan are not only clothes, but also the symbol of company cultural. At last, the top designer of QD site, Tracy appeared stunningly in a red Chinese dress and shared her story about the past 20 years’ process of struggle in company. After that, our models sang “the song of time” together with Tracy’s beautiful piano. The graceful song let everyone remember the pleasant days we spent in this company. 
  
Then came to the most expecting event: anniversary speech. During lunch time, everyone came to the stage and said something about the feeling of past years. Some of them showed their thanksgiving to the ones who helped them; some looked back at the growth of themselves: from boy to a father, or from a girl to a manager; some members told their story of friends, who still fought together, or who left for another goal. Everyone get touched by colleagues’ engagement stories and aspirations with the company.
 
At last, Happy Job Team members provided a splendid dance “Shaping the future together”. This dance made the Anniversary celebration more lively and boisterous. 

Anniversary Celebration aims to bring the appreciation to every employee who spent 5/10/15/20 years for the growth of this company, it also provided a milestone for everyone to look back and start a new career journey. It’s very proud for HJT to hold such ceremony every year, we will continue serving QD site and the company with great passion!

body.parsed:
HetRAN GSM-A Squad member’s view on the MN transformation. Please post more examples to help the transformation success. 

Flexibility, form guild team for the lab task force team to engage team members.
Responsibility, decision making and execution from front line engineer to speed up action.
Innovation, more initiative idea to help on speed and quality for product.
Responsiveness, use wechat to speed up the discussion rather than taking time on meetings

attachments.content_excerpt:
The world is changing the way it operates, the company is changing the way it executes, our life is changing the way we communicate.
Our mission has changed to continuously improve our productivity and cost structure to maintain MN profitable, resilient and agile in an aggressively competitive environment.

So how can we catch up the changing speed in our daily work? Let's listen to the voice from Qingdao HetRAN GSM-A squad members on the transformation from 4 perspectives.

 Flexibility, form guild team for the lab task force team to engage team members.
 Responsibility, decision making and execution from front line engineer to speed up action.
 Innovation, more initiative idea to help on speed and quality for product.
 Responsiveness, use wechat to speed up the discussion rather than taking time on meetings

cc: Adolfo Masini, Soltykiewicz, Joe (Nokia - US/Naperville), Pat Oregan, (NSN - PL/Krakow), Humeau, Jean-Paul (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Chen, Ming Seaman. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Li, Ellen J. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Li, Xin Vincent (NSB - CN/Qingdao)

body.parsed: Please "Like" us to show your support to Innovation, thanks!
body.plain: Please "Like" us to show your support to Innovation, thanks!(1 Share attached)
body.rich: Please "Like" us to show your support to Innovation, thanks!

attachments.content_excerpt:
Welcome to Innovation 2017, We Innovate Our Future!

To support Innovation Team, please click "like". Thank you for your passion on Innovation!

You can find Wang, Mike (Nokia - CN/Beijing)'s VCR from our video. He showed a best wishes and great support to Innovation in 2017. You can also find OzO(OZO Technical Support) VR camera in our video too. Pretty cool, right?

Innovation is always the top competence that QD site is focusing to build. Build on top of our existing Innovation Activities, many interesting and encouraging improvement projects are in action:

1. GIM:
As the first time, QD location participates the Nokia Global Innovation Mall program in 2017. Innovation team drives the R&D, extends to whole location, actively contributes to the innovation of Nokia products and strategic areas. Major achievements include:
- More than 500 ideas were received, and more than 200 ideas will be implemented by this year.
- More than 500 of all employees were engaged in this activity, including submitting ideas, commenting on ideas, assessing ideas and implementing ideas.
- Over 500 K euro of net value was obtained from the ideas so far, coming from cost saving benefit and additional extended benefits.
- QD location GIM is No.1 in GIM InnoPoint/Head score across all global sites.

2. Garage:
With the support from Wang, Mike (Nokia - CN/Beijing), Zhang Bing, OzO team from Beijing, Legal department of ASB, local PR, IT, R&D, QD Innovation Team, as well as local Universities and many famous local companies, Nokia Garage.QD opened on Oct 10, 2017. Nokia Garage.QD is the first Nokia Garage in China. It will greatly help Nokia to connect the innovative ideas with resources, and support the long term growth of Qingdao Site.

So far, the significant achievements:
- QD Big Event: Garage Opening
Wang, Mike (Nokia - CN/Beijing), Zhang bing and high-level leaders joined the event. Wang, Mike (Nokia - CN/Beijing) sent a VCR to show his best wishes to Nokia Garage.QD.
Also, OzO device demonstrated the powerful technology of Nokia Global.

- Ecosystem: seeking for external resource
More than 20 postgraduate students from China Ocean University and Qingdao Technology and Science University joined the session. We set up 3 teams for GIM implementation.

- Ecosystem: Broadcast Nokia value
Lectures to Qingdao University to show Nokia’s value and Nokia Garage concept. Delivered Nokia’s social responsibility and high-technology. This behavior built a great image of Nokia to students.

- Cooperation with University
China Ocean University will send post graduate students to Garage practice from 2018. They will focus on practice and GIM implementation. This will reduce a lot of effort of idea owners.
Nokia Garage.QD was running for only 2 months. We are trying our best to make tangible benefit to all company and staff. With your support, Nokia Garage.QD will bring more and more benefit to this company and to everyone.

3. More attractive activities will keep coming in the coming two months of 2017:
- QD Technical Journal 2017 version
- DIA program chairman visit in end of Nov, great opportunity to build our innovative ideas into business
- Innovation Day (AKA. Golden Idea Contest)
- InnoMaster Workshop for all China sites

attachments.content_excerpt:
Cloud Core Customer Experience Survey newsletter (October) 2017
Nokia Global CPVi at October ended at 59.7% which was down slightly from last month of 59.8%. (Today’s value is 58.8%). At Nokia level, 23 customers interviewed to see how Nokia fulfill customers’ expectations additionally compared with competitors. 81.9% of overall respondents answered positively when asked about Nokia quality while 14.3% of respondents (YTD) feel that quality has either decreased or stayed on a negative level.
The 23 interviewed customers are AT&T Mexico, British Telecom, Claro Brasil, COX, CTC HQ, CUC Hebei, CUC Inner Mongolia, Elisa, everything everywhere, MBNL, NBN, O2 UK, Orange Cameroon, Salt, Singtel Singapore, Spark New Zealand, T-Mobile Czech/Slovak Telekom, Tele2 Russia, Telefonica Colombia, Telekom Austria Group, TIM Brasil, Vodafone New Zealand and Vodafone UK

The CC analysis show that in general the 13 CC customers ....

cc: Kumar, Maneesh 2. (Nokia - US/Naperville), Griesshammer, Jochen (Nokia - DE/Munich), Antoniou, Aspasia (Nokia - GR/Athens), Schroepfer, Scott (Nokia - US/Naperville), Ganesh, Aparna (Nokia - IN/Bangalore)

body.parsed:
2017 Qingdao TC "Best Improvement Project" Award – We Innovate Our Future!

Innovation is always the top competence that QD site is focusing to build. Build on top of our existing Innovation Activities, in 2017 many interesting and encouraging improvement projects are in action:

1. GIM:
As the first time, QD location participates the Nokia Global Innovation Mall program in 2017. Innovation GIM team actively contributes to the innovation of Nokia products and strategic areas:
- Over 500 ideas were received, and more than 200 ideas will be implemented by this year.
- Over 500 of all employees were engaged in this activity, including submitting ideas, commenting on ideas, assessing ideas and implementing ideas.
- Over 500 K Euro of net value was obtained from the ideas so far, coming from cost saving benefit and additional extended benefits.
- QD location GIM is No.1 in GIM InnoPoint/Head score across all global sites.

2. Garage:
The last mile in innovation -- Incubation is always the hottest and hardest part. With the support from top leadership team, OzO team from Beijing, Legal department of NSB, QD Innovation Team, as well as local Universities and many famous local companies, Nokia Garage.QD was opened on Oct 10, 2017. It is the first Nokia Garage in China. It will greatly help Nokia to connect the innovative ideas with resources, and support the long term growth of Qingdao Site: 
- QD Big Event: Garage Opening 
All high-level QD leaders joined the event. Mike Wang sent a VCR to show his best wishes to Nokia Garage.QD. 
OzO device demonstrated the powerful technology of Nokia Global. 
- Ecosystem: Broadcast Nokia value
Lectures to Qingdao University to show Nokia’s value and Nokia Garage concept. Delivered Nokia’s social responsibility and built a great image of Nokia brand. 
- Operation: Seeking for external resource
More than 20 postgraduate students from local Universities joined the session. 3 teams are setup for GIM idea implementation. Next year, China Ocean University agree to send post graduate students to Garage for practice from 2018.

3. More attractive activities keep coming in the last two months of 2017:
- QD Technical Journal 2017 version
- DIA program chairman visit in end of Nov, great opportunity to build our innovative ideas into business
- Innovation Day (AKA. Golden Idea Contest)
- InnoMaster Workshop for all China sites

body.parsed:
MN China DevOps knowledge sharing activities have been launched!!

Dear colleagues,

It’s pleasure to inform you that MN China DevOps knowledge sharing activities have been formally launched, 
as a complementary part of global DevOps EDU plan, we’ll focus on tools, technologies and our daily practices, 
and also you can access DevOps collection in the Learning Store 
to check more fundamental on-line courses based on your needs.

You can find the sessions planned in Nov 2017 from attached figure, 
detailed agenda and introduction could be found in linked invitations, 
please use Ctrl + Click on them and save to your calendar. 
We are looking forward to your participation ^_^

Should you have any related questions, please feel free to contact Cindy Chi, Vincent Li

Links for 6 sessions:
1. Service-Discovery in Cloud-Native Application  11/10 -> https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/CMNP/Transformation/Programs/_layouts/15/DocIdRedir.aspx?ID=2TIBP33IU4UQ-1586412025-187

2. Centralized Resource Manager for Continuous Delivery Pipeline  11/10 ->
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/CMNP/Transformation/Programs/_layouts/15/DocIdRedir.aspx?ID=2TIBP33IU4UQ-1586412025-186

3. Docker Basic Introduction 11/17 ->
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/CMNP/Transformation/Programs/_layouts/15/DocIdRedir.aspx?ID=2TIBP33IU4UQ-1586412025-185

4. NTAS containerization 11/17 ->
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/CMNP/Transformation/Programs/_layouts/15/DocIdRedir.aspx?ID=2TIBP33IU4UQ-1586412025-183

5. TigerShark Introduction 11/22 ->
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/CMNP/Transformation/Programs/_layouts/15/DocIdRedir.aspx?ID=2TIBP33IU4UQ-1586412025-190

6. Kubernetes Basic Introduction 11/24 ->
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/CMNP/Transformation/Programs/_layouts/15/DocIdRedir.aspx?ID=2TIBP33IU4UQ-1586412025-184

3GC Cloud Hands-on Training is Launched!!

In November (11/13~11/30), [Professor Come] and 9381 team plan to deliver 7 cloud hands-on sessions.
Each session will last 3 hours including register, instruction, quiz & hands-on practice. 
We want every colleague of 3GC have chance to practice cloud knowledge.
Please see the detail agenda and find which group you are in from the table in the figure. If you have any conflict,  please exchange 1 vs 1 with other colleague personally. 
Wish you have a good training time ~

body.parsed: A small video of Process Flow Automation and everything could be automated.
body.plain: A small video of Process Flow Automation and everything could be automated.(1 Share attached)
body.rich: A small video of Process Flow Automation and everything could be automated.

attachments.content_excerpt:
Dear All,

I would like to share a short video about the first implemented slice of Process Flow Automation project.
It is a teaser on Milestone Criteria handling as we rethink the well-known excel based solution, implemented in JIRA and Confluence. This new solution is developed in cooperation with Quality and Create Process team.

What is't fit into the video:
• Milestone Criteria handling is only one module of the whole Process Flow Automation E2E solution.
• Related Pilots are in progress
• Together with other modules (e.g. common backlog) you can get an overall and always up to date picture from your ongoing programs.
• PFA system is easily extended with PowerBI visualisation and supply information to provide predictability of program Milestone acceptance applying Analytics.
• With Process Flow Automation the Processes become: Harmonized, Optimized and Digitalized.
• Use of this solution results: convenient use, avoidable meetings, unavoidable process, less waste, clear responsibility and live status.

Stay tuned, more will come soon

cc: Clever, Michael (Nokia - DE/Munich), Drobcsak, Teodor (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Deme, Sandor (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Kumar, Maneesh 2. (Nokia - US/Naperville), Vainio, Timo (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Berrahil, Said (Nokia - HU/Budapest)

body.parsed:
MN Lean Best Practice Sharing Series@ Qingdao TC    – Session 4

On Nov.1st, the 4th session of MN Lean best practice sharing across Qingdao TC was successfully launched in new center TR2. 
It’s our honor that to invite Grace Zhao, Qingdao Register Tribe leader to kick off this sharing salon with her profound understanding of Lean and her recognition to this sharing platform. 

4 creative projects selected from MN products were shared in this session, 3GCore, cIMS&DC, SDM and HetRan-GSMA. Colleagues from MN as well as other BLs joined this sharing talk. Most of them expressed it’s a very good platform for communication. 

All the audiences attended this sharing session voted the “Best Creative Lean Project”. It’s the honor here to announce the “Best Creative Lean Project” goes to “NTAS Standard Configuration” from TAS. Congratulations to them! 
The prize will be presented on “MN Lean Day” celebration on Nov.17 soon. Stay tuned, We’ll be back !

body.parsed:
Characteristic that every Squad, squad group and Tribe must have
1. Willingness to own (customer centricity, E2E)
2. Love for quality (rapid learning, focus)
3. People (aotonomy) 

How to create an autonomous team. Niklas Nordling explains the behavioral perspective in his 20 min recorded presentation. (Copy the link to Chrome or Firefox). 
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/changeculturesquad/_layouts/15/guestaccess.aspx?guestaccesstoken=jw91DTVBdpJu4o%2FmmLE0iV79LGvvCXb02R8vJOut9LQ%3D&docid=2_0f46beeb2332940b0bfa692e82fa99cf2&rev=1&e=e665fd96f635429b8d15fe06e1e692f1

In Niklas's slide, he covered "Trian the Brian" concept. Turing Luo, Haiming Wang and Vincent Li shared the key note of SCARF, Insight and Growth mindset with their personal experience in the change culture workshop this summer. You may talk to him if needed.

body.parsed:
MN Transformation workshop for squad leaders@ Qingdao on Oct.30th,2017

Around 20 squad leaders from MN cloud core and HetRanGSM joined Qingdao MN Transformation workshop in the afternoon of Oct.30th. 
As MN new architecture based organization change, our tribes are encouraged to think and act like start-ups, and will be enabled to do so by providing autonomy in terms of decision making. Squads will develop themselves to be E2E capable, being able to specify, develop, test and deliver what they create, independently from other teams. 

Ellen Li, Qingdao TC Head hosted this workshop with an inspiring opening speech to explain the purpose of this workshop that is to drive the change and inspire all squad members to deliver this vision. Klaus Zhang, MN CC Qingdao Tribe leader introduced and shared the changes coming up and R&D blueprint that defines the structure and roles, which triggered hot discussion among all squad leaders. 
Afterwards, all squad leaders are divided into 5 groups to discuss about their plan to implement the change within their Squad.

Comprehensive info delivered under hot discussion. Grace Zhao, Register R&D tribe leader gave a wrap-up at the end of this workshop. The world is changing as always and we need to be ready to embrace it as always. This is just a start to transform to new way of working, we’ll keep up and strive for our ways to fulfil the target - simplicity, agility and speed!

attachments.title: Engage in discussion on Q3 results in Yammer
attachments.content_excerpt:
Dear Colleagues, Nokia announced the Q3 financials on Oct. 26—achieving 5.5 billion net sales, 42.7% gross margin and 12.1% operating margin(Non-IFRS). Greater China achieved 630 million net sales, 13% of Nokia group.

The overall market condition is quite challenging; Rajeev said in his letter that “we have seen the impact of tough market conditions and some of our own execution issues” . This is also true at our regional level. We have to face up to the problems and challenges, and stick together to improve and shape the future together (齐心创未来).

I just had the Line Managers call this morning, and I will host town halls in Beijing and Shanghai in the coming days, sharing with you all the Q3 updates at global and GCHN levels. In the meantime, let’s also engage in the discussion about our Q3 results here in Yammer.
Best regards, Mike

attachments.content_excerpt:
PLEARN is the name of our MN Competence Development portal.
(the name is produced from PLAY and LEARN.
Our vision is to make Learning approachable and fun.

Here is our PLEARN page:
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/plearn/SitePages/Home.aspx
This is the starting point for our journey through MN transformation linking to to learning artifacts, best practices, methods needed.

Note that portal has currently initial content and is enriched with much more in Q4.2017.

Focus on “PLAY” and “NEW” tabs so as to get the basics in order to get started.

We would appreciate your comments on what to improve / add in this portal using our MN CoDe yammer or e-mail: mn.code@nokia.com

https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=12942919&view=all

body.parsed: MN Quality new org
body.plain: MN Quality new org(1 Share attached)
body.rich: MN Quality new org

attachments.content_excerpt:
Further appointments on the MNQ organization

Earlier this week, Deepti shared the new structure and direction of the MN Quality organization. To reiterate, we have an important role to play in the MN transformation to an architecture-driven structure and Quality First culture. The changes and our new way of working were designed to leverage our quality management experience and expertise, driving it more deeply into MN. They are also meant to empower MN & MN Quality as we collectively deliver the quality that our customers expect through a pervasive, Quality First mindset.

Let’s recap the structure. Our Quality Management teams establish the MN quality ambition, strategy, process and policies, including developing and governing the multi-year KPIs, essential to keeping our sights focused on current performance while proactively identifying improvement areas. Some of our functions will be offered as an on-demand service. The Rapid Quality Intervention teams deliver fast turnaround assessments and analysis to launch programs that surgically address immediate customer pain-points as well as systemics that present risks within MN or across Nokia. The Quality Competence, Quality Automation and Quality Transformation teams provide expert counsel, cloud-era practices, digital models, external benchmarking and coaching on a range of strategic topics – from quality best practices, workflow automation and predictive tools, to major differentiators like Cost of Poor Quality.

Today we are providing further details on the organization, outlining the structure of each squad and its leadership. We are pleased to announce the following appointments, effective immediately:

Quality Management - Cloud Solutions and 5G:
- 5G RAN – Michel Garrigues
- Cloud Solutions – Ramprasad T S
- Edge Cloud – Amy Yue
- ATF – Alan Miller
- Management and Network Orchestration (MANO) & AR/VR – Rachel Sun
- E2E Transport – Vidya Shenoy
- Small Cells – Edward Lubkiewicz
- Vertical Network Slices – Heinz Kruse

Quality Management – Telco:
- 4G RAN – Anna Hajduk
- Single RAN – Sunita Chauhan
- HetRAN – Duncan Zhang
- Smart Radio – Ellen Truby
- Baseband – Ellen Truby
- Cloud Core – Aparna Ganesh
- Cloud Development Services – Timo Rajamaki

Rapid Quality Intervention:
- Customer Squad – Christine Dong
- Solutions Squad – Aspasia Antoniou
- Software Squad – Robin Chu and Michal Piekos
- Hardware Squad – Jeanne Cseri-Martin
- Belt Squad – Janik Dafcik
- Product Sales – Janik Dafcik
- Business Management – Janik Dafcik
- Rapid Customer Intervention – Christine Dong
- Customer Support – Leo Sorokin

Quality Competence:
- Quality Culture – Jorma Pulkkinen
- Continuous Improvement – Cindy Waters
- Process Consultation – Tony Song

Quality Automation: All squad members will be direct reports to Maneesh.

Quality Transformation: All squad members will be direct reports to Scott.

The full organization chart is available online.

Please join us in congratulating the new leaders and wish them success in their new role. We are confident that together our team will achieve success in the new opportunities that lie ahead. As always, please reach out to any of us with questions, comments or concerns.
.

Best regards,

Maneesh, Sunita, Scott, Tony

https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MNQ/SiteAssets/SitePages/MN%20Quality%20organization/MN%20Quality%20Org%20Chart.pdf

body.parsed:
On Oct.18th, the 3nd session of MN Lean best practice sharing across Qingdao TC was successfully launched in new center TR2. 
Qingdao TC Head Ellen Li kicked off this sharing series with current company’s strategy and leading tread.

4 projects related to “Automation” were shared from MN 4 BLs, cIMS&DC, 3Gcore, SDM and HetRan-GSMA. Colleagues from MN as well as other BLs joined this sharing talk. Most of them expressed it’s a very good occasion for common ideas’ communication. We can learn from each other for this leading strategy’s implementation from different products. 

All the audiences attended this sharing session voted the “Best Automation Project”. It’s the honor here to announce the “Best Automation Project” belongs to “Keyword driven automation” from 3GCore. Congratulation to them! 
The prize will be presented on “MN Lean Day” celebration in Nov. this year.

body.parsed:
NOKIA garage Qingdao was launched on October 10th with the theme “a connected world”. The aim is to bring Nokia Garage culture into China, build the open innovation ecosystem and incubate ideas into business. 
~70 visitors from high-tech companies, start-up companies and universities joined NOKIA Qingdao garage opening. They showed strong desire to join and seek cooperation opportunities. 
Mike Wang, President of Nokia Greater China and General Manager of NSB said in his opening speech: "Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. Innovation is a constant theme throughout Nokia’s 150 development history. Nokia has established ~$350 million investment fund for investments in Internet of Things. Qingdao R&D team is full of passion with deep-rooted innovation culture. The team has 270 IPR with successful innovation experience. Garage will excel Qingdao’s innovation to next level.” Zhang Bin, President of Nokia Qingdao pointed out a concept of development that only those companies insisting on innovation can have the opportunity of remaining invincible.

The visitors and our experts had in-depth discussion in the areas of "next generation network", "cloud computing" and "innovation practice". Wang Zhengang delivered the speech of 5G technology. Zhao Yufeng, the director of Hisense multimedia R&D, shared the "Hisense virtual reality industry development practice". Wei Liang, the director from TGOOD showed the innovation journey of TGOOD cloud architecture evolution. All the discussions and generated ideas will be further evaluated and considered as input of Garage. We also signed the innovation cooperation framework with universities to promote Nokia innovation culture into young talents.

Please join Global Day of Learning on Wednesday, October 11th.  The theme is "Shaping our Future Together" to be a top 10 technology company. Connect ourself to the emerging techonologies and be a transformation agent. 

Please visit the GDOL website https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/gdol2017/SitePages/index.aspx and view the full schedule of webcast sessions to plan your day of learning. Also check out the in-person events taking place at many of our main locations around the globe.

attachments.content_excerpt:
A reminder for you and your teams to join Marc Rouanne, Rajeev Suri and many others for Global Day of Learning on Wednesday, October 11th.

The theme for this year's event is Shaping our Future Together: How Nokia is delivering on our promise to be a Top 10 technology company. We will discuss progress on our Rebalancing for Growth strategy, take a closer look at our end-to-end portfolio and emerging technologies and focus on how we're transforming to become Connected Employees.

Please visit the GDOL website https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/gdol2017/SitePages/index.aspx and view the full schedule of webcast sessions to plan your day of learning. Also check out the in-person events taking place at many of our main locations around the globe.

attachments.content_excerpt:
Check out our brief "Blockchain: Introduction and Relevance to Nokia" white paper, straight from the Advanced Research Lab in Cambridge.

Aimed at all audiences, it attempts to explain the essence of the technology and how it could be relevant to Nokia.

Looking forward to your feedback and comments! :)

cc: Troels Rønnow, Palyutina, Karina (Nokia - GB/Cambridge), Fitzgerald, Edward (Nokia - GB/Cambridge), Wabnig, Joachim (Nokia - GB/Cambridge), Mattila, Ville-Veikko (Nokia-TECH/Tampere), Antti Niskanen, Schroeder, Erich (Nokia - US/Murray Hill), Pellikka, Jarkko (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Gustafsson, Mikael (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Hamiti, Shkumbin (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Walid, Anwar (Nokia - US/Murray Hill), Schlage, Fabian (Nokia - DE/Munich), Leppa, Kirsi (Nokia - FI/Espoo)

Each of the them is the nice preparation for the next year.

attachments.content_excerpt:
Nokia Garage is opening on 10th, Oct. We will invite invite Haier, Hisense, TGood, Elight, Centling, China Ocean Uni, Qingdao Uni, CCF, YOCSEF and several Incubator Enterprise in leading to join the celebration.
So, we have representatives from Enterprise, University, Incubator and External Community. We will take this chance to establish the connection to many more organization based on technology and market. Ecosystem is started from the day. Besides, OzO will show up.

Welcome to join, wish us a brilliant day :-)

幸福的秘诀
>幸福是用来感觉的，而不是用来比较的。
> 生活是用来经营的，而不是用来计较的。
> 感情是用来维系的，而不是用来考验的。
> 家人是用来疼爱的，而不是用来伤害的。
> 金钱是用来付出的，而不是用来衡量的。
> 谎言是用来击破的，而不是用来粉饰的。
> 信任是用来沉淀的，而不是用来挑战的

body.parsed:
This is the 3rd Nokia Qingdao English Contest speech. Congratultions to Cindy Chi for the final winner. She shared her personal experience in the English growing. She joined the contest 3 times. From the green-bird, to the winner, her experience is very inspiring. More improtant, we can learn that every success has some common characteristics as Cindy summaried.  They are
1. Be brave to take actions
2. Attitude matters and learn from failures
3. More practice and well preparation

Thanks again
Ellen

body.parsed: GIM best contributor award in 2017 3rd quarter comes, let's congratulate the winners!
body.plain: GIM best contributor award in 2017 3rd quarter comes, let's congratulate the winners!(1 Share attached)
body.rich: GIM best contributor award in 2017 3rd quarter comes, let's congratulate the winners!

attachments.content_excerpt:
Every quarter, QingDao InnoBoard will select the best contributors to GIM, and present their contribution in the site-level all manager meeting. Those best contributors are nominated by idea managers in each department, and are selected by InnoBoard from their:
1, Volume of GIM ideas
2, Quality of GIM ideas
3, Contribution in idea implementations
And here comes our winners in 2017 3rd quarter.

Also, three best ideas will be selected each quarter. And the winner of this award will have a chance to present his/her idea in the all manager meeting, to spread their ideas and inspire more.

body.parsed:
MN Lean Best Practice Sharing Series@ Qingdao TC    – Session 2 Push to Cloud

On Sep.21st, the 2nd session of MN Lean best practice sharing across Qingdao TC was successfully launched in new center TR2. 

Qingdao HetRan-GSMA leader Seaman Chen kicked off this sharing series with an inspiring opening speech. 
3 projects related to “push to cloud” were shared from MN 3 BLs, cIMS&DC, 3Gcore and HetRan-GSMA. Colleagues from MN as well as other BLs joined this sharing talk. Most of them expressed it’s a very good occasion for common ideas’ communication. We can learn from each other for this leading strategy’s implementation from different products. 

All the audiences attended this sharing voted the “Best Push to Cloud Project”. It’s the honor here to announce the “Best Push to Cloud Project” belongs to “GSM Cloud Testing Environment”. Applause & Congratulations! 
The prize will be presented on “MN Lean Day” celebration around early Nov. this year. Looking forward to “Qingdao MN Lean Day”!

body.parsed: Cloud Core Recovery meeting -- Quality first principle requires accurate planning, prediction fault model and user experience from customer perspectives.
body.plain: Cloud Core Recovery meeting -- Quality first principle requires accurate planning, prediction fault model and user experience from customer perspectives.(1 Share attached)
body.rich: Cloud Core Recovery meeting -- Quality first principle requires accurate planning, prediction fault model and user experience from customer perspectives.

attachments.content_excerpt:
Today I was participating in the Cloud Core Recovery meeting and two points struck me during the whole review.

1) In one of our programs we were again in a rush to declare P7 (which has already been delayed) and we had a nice plan to finish the mandatory documentation as per the P7 checklist but other important documentation like configuration guides were planned between P7 and P8. I wondered, are we still following the quality first principle? are we looking at the deliverable from customer perspective? Will the customers be pained by not having such basic documentation?. and then the second part of this , why is it that customer documentation is the last focus , why is it not build in our plan well in advance.
how can we get over this practice?

2) There are programs which end up facing the flak and participate in the Recovery meeting every other month (recovery plan also has not worked, not once but few times). how do we do more accurate planning and replanning , what predictions models to use (close to P7 Fault prediction model, test execution rate can be used, what can we use earlier in the game).
how do we do a better failure mode analysis of our program plans? its very important to have a robust program plan which is based on good assumptions , risk assessments and well supported by prediction model.
lets continue to ask for customer centric mindset and robust program planning(utilising right tools and methods)

The good part though during the review was that Michael and the leadership team pushed back on these programs to come back with more details before new program dates are approved.

Thoughts welcome

Kumar, Maneesh 2. (Nokia - US/Naperville)

cc: Clever, Michael (Nokia - DE/Munich), Asmi, Outi (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Martinozzi, Nawida (Nokia - DE/Munich), Lutz, Gisela (Nokia - DE/Munich), Shenoy, Vidya (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), Ganesh, Aparna (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), Rajamaki, Timo (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Antoniou, Aspasia (Nokia - GR/Athens), T S, Ramprasad (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), Mihalka, Gergely (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Reiss, Matthias (Nokia - DE/Munich), Woerdehoff, Alois (Nokia - DE/Munich), Szatmari, Julia (Nokia - HU/Budapest)

1) In one of our programs we were again in a rush to declare P7 (which has already been delayed) and we had a nice plan to finish the mandatory documentation as per the P7 checklist but other important documentation like configuration guides were planned between P7 and P8. I wondered, are we still following the quality first principle? are we looking at the deliverable from customer perspective? Will the customers be pained by not having such basic documentation?. and then the second part of this , why is it that customer documentation is the last focus , why is it not build in our plan well in advance.
how can we get over this practice?

2) There are programs which end up facing the flak and participate in the Recovery meeting every other month (recovery plan also has not worked, not once but few times). how do we do more accurate planning and replanning , what predictions models to use (close to P7 Fault prediction model, test execution rate can be used, what can we use earlier in the game).
how do we do a better failure mode analysis of our program plans? its very important to have a robust program plan which is based on good assumptions , risk assessments and well supported by prediction model.
lets continue to ask for customer centric mindset and robust program planning(utilising right tools and methods)

The good part though during the review was that Michael and the leadership team pushed back on these programs to come back with more details before new program dates are approved.

Thoughts welcome

Kumar, Maneesh 2. (Nokia - US/Naperville)

cc: Clever, Michael (Nokia - DE/Munich), Asmi, Outi (Nokia - FI/Espoo), Martinozzi, Nawida (Nokia - DE/Munich), Lutz, Gisela (Nokia - DE/Munich), Shenoy, Vidya (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), Ganesh, Aparna (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), Rajamaki, Timo (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Antoniou, Aspasia (Nokia - GR/Athens), T S, Ramprasad (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), Mihalka, Gergely (Nokia - HU/Budapest), Reiss, Matthias (Nokia - DE/Munich), Woerdehoff, Alois (Nokia - DE/Munich), Szatmari, Julia (Nokia - HU/Budapest)

body.parsed:
Qingdao site has a long history of patent filing, and one good practice in building this culture is the Patent Wall.
 Starting from 2004, with the great effort in patent process trainings and case sharing sessions coordinated by QD Innovation Team, Qingdao R&D has entered a booming age of patent filing, total 41 patents were filed in 3 years. 
 In 2008, to further recognize and encourage inventors, Innovation Team decided to build the patent wall at the main building entrance, more than 100 patents were recorded in the first version of Patent Wall.

 With more and more engineers started their encouraging journey on innovation, filed patent number kept grow year by year, and the Patent Wall grows larger and larger, and Innovation team had to reconstruct the Patent Wall for higher density.

 The purpose of a patent wall is not only to recognize the inventors, but also to encourage everyone. Innovation is sometimes considered as an important but not urgent task in engineers daily work, when people know some innovation big guy filed a patent, they feel nothing, but when he/she got to know that someone in his/her average filed a patent, this makes them know patent is not so far away from them but achievable, they will put their ideas into a submission right away.

 In the latest Qingdao patent record, total 270 patents were filed from more than 150 inventors.

attachments.title: A message from Marc: Mobile Networks organization update (further details in addition to the announcement made on August 17)
attachments.content_excerpt:
Dear colleagues,

As Monika Maurer, Nokia COO, announced today, Jörg Erlemeier, MN COO, will become the head of the planned new Nokia Transformation function in COO as of October 1. Together with Jörg, the MN Transformation Organization team of Sergio Duroux and the MN Book Office team of Harald Lausecker are planned to move to COO. These teams will continue with their existing assignments towards Mobile Networks and Global Services as before, expanding to additional programs across Nokia.

In his new role, Jörg will be responsible for supporting the transformation of the entire company, ensuring that Nokia is moving forward with continued optimization and renewal as part of its long-term transformation. Mobile Networks will continue to own and be accountable for MN Smarter programs, the synergy programs and all its future transformation programs, and will be supported by COO through a tight Service Level Agreement.

Jörg, Sergio and Harald have ensured the integration of a part of the legacy Alcatel-Lucent portfolio into Mobile Networks, and our business group to become more efficient while merging these two big organizations. I am proud to see them taking on roles in COO for the benefit of the entire company, and I am convinced this planned move will ensure that all our continued efforts to transform MN are closely linked to similar ambitions and activities in the five other business groups and at corporate level. Their teams and expertise will continue to be at the service of MN as well as for other business groups and functions.

The consultation process with the works councils/employee representatives regarding the planned changes in MN Operations is still ongoing. Further details will be shared as soon as possible.
Please join me in thanking Jörg, Harald and Sergio and in wishing them success in their new roles. Personally, I am looking forward to continued cooperation with all three of them.

Best regards,
Marc

For further information:
- Marc Rouanne’s letter (Aug 17): Announcement of the next milestone in MN’s transformation (http://)
- Monika Maurer’s letter (Aug 29): Transforming Nokia for growth (http://)

cc: Rouanne, Marc (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay), Erlemeier, Joerg (Nokia - DE/Munich), Duroux, Sergio (Nokia - IT/Vimercate), Lausecker, Harald (Nokia - DE/Munich)

body.parsed:
MN Lean Best Practice Sharing Series@ Qingdao TC    – Session 1 Continuous Integration

On Aug.28th, the first session of MN Lean best practice sharing across Qingdao TC was successfully launched. 
Qingdao MN Lean leader Roy Wang kicked off this sharing series with an inspiring opening speech. MN Lean is a scientific methodology which could drive us to new era of working mode and make change to adapt to new technology industry. Just like our slogan “You can make the change”, Nokia is making the change as always. 

5 CI projects were shared from MN 4 BLs, cIMS&DC, cSDM, 3Gcore and HetRan-GSMA. It’s a relatively free sharing talk with open and relaxed atmosphere. A lot of questions and comments raised during the sharing with sparkles flashed. 

Colleagues from MN as well as other BLs joined this sharing talk as well. Most of them expressed it’s a very good occasion/platform for common ideas’ communication. We can learn from each other for this leading strategy’s implementation from different products. 

Afterwards, all the audiences attended this sharing has one chance to select the “Best CI Project” in their mind. It’s the honor here to announce the “Best CI Project” belongs to “SDM CI Practice Sharing”. Applause & Congratulations! 
The prize will be presented on “MN Lean Day” celebration around early Nov. this year. Looking forward to “Qingdao MN Lean Day”!

body.parsed:
麦叔早茶 - 8/28

在没钱的时候， 把勤舍出去， 钱就来了。 ——这叫天道酬勤。    
当有钱的时候， 把钱舍出去， 人就来了。 ——这叫轻财聚人。     
当有人的时候， 把爱舍出去， 事业就来了。 ——这叫厚德载物。 
当事业成功后， 把智慧舍出去， 喜悦就来了。 ——这叫德行天下。   
没有舍、 就没有得…！世界是圆的, 你怎么对别人， 别人就怎么对你 。
body.plain:
麦叔早茶 - 8/28

在没钱的时候， 把勤舍出去， 钱就来了。 ——这叫天道酬勤。
当有钱的时候， 把钱舍出去， 人就来了。 ——这叫轻财聚人。
当有人的时候， 把爱舍出去， 事业就来了。 ——这叫厚德载物。
当事业成功后， 把智慧舍出去， 喜悦就来了。 ——这叫德行天下。
没有舍、 就没有得…！世界是圆的, 你怎么对别人， 别人就怎么对你 。

body.parsed:
2017 QD R&D Board Game 
     2017 Qingdao R&D Board Game was successfully held from 7th to 16th August 2017, it has already become a traditional event in Qingdao. Totally 32 teams from different departments joined this contest. Players brought countless exciting matches to us in this hot summer day. Finally,  “清夏之队” from CTS won the first prize by their great teamwork and good fortune.
     This activity was organized by Happy Job Team with the theme of bringing joy, strengthening team work and building healthier environment.  Board games bring us a lot of fun in this hot summer. Both players and non-players took an active part in the preparation and competition. Regardless of the result, we hope everyone enjoyed the game and get refreshed for better work!

attachments.content_excerpt: Dear all, in order to be successful in implementing the strategic direction Marc described in his posts it is key to invest in develop our soft skills (behaviors, risk taking mindset,..) accordingly. NokiaEDU has recently launched the IDEAL (Innovative, Digital, Entrepreneurial, Agile, Learning) learning program specifically designed to prepare Nokia employees for the Connected World. This cutting-edge learning opportunity strengthens our competence in business-critical areas, including creativity, innovation, entrepreneurial mindset, agile spirit and digital workplace awareness. IDEAL is essential content for everyone in Nokia and the entire program takes less than 10 hours to complete. I strongly recommend it to you and ask your support to cascade/push it to your teams. To access the program, visit the IDEAL SharePoint site at https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/ideal/SitePages/Home.aspx.

body.rich: Here is the global SRDT improvement project on the ‘WannaCry’ cyber Attack. In Qigndao, we also have similar project. Rocket Sun is the project leader to improve our local lab security level. Thanks a lot Rocket and the lab virtual team for your great support.

attachments.content_excerpt:
MN Laboratory Cyber Security

Do you remember the ‘WannaCry’ cyber Attack?
Even while the event has gone past, we cannot deny these attacks happening more frequently. In an increasingly digitized world, the value of personal and company data has grown tremendously creating a threat landscape from which no company is immune. In such an environment, it’s critical and essential to have fool-proof security controls and protect our digital assets from any potential threats.

Do you wonder then how and who protects our Mobile Networks laboratories?

The lab cyber security specialists (one in each lab locations) in SRDT LabServices delivery team care for this through MN Laboratory Cyber security project. This project implements multi-layered defense-in-depth approach to protect our digital Lab assets. It ensures that the security posture of labs is properly managed and checks whether the appropriate security controls are still active and effective.

Following are the ongoing cyber security project activities across MN labs and Target completion dates:
• Antivirus for Windows OS – 31 Aug’17
• Patching: configure Nokia internal WSUS for Windows OS – 31 Aug’17
• OS Hardening – 31 Oct’17
• Performing a periodic vulnerability assessment across all MN Labs. – 31 Oct’17
• Monitoring and responding to the alerts to prevent, detect, and respond in a timely manner – 30th Sep’17
• Clean up of firewall rules – 31 Oct’17

How can you help to prevent or minimize impact , if there comes next malware attack?
The following fundamental steps
1. "Phish-proof" employees: Socially engineered, fraudulent "phishing" emails are the most common way systems get infected with ransomware. Information Security training helps you recognize such messages. Stay Vigilant!
2. Know what you have: IP asset inventory system roll out has started for the lab assets to maintain a complete configuration management data base (CMDB). If you have actions or information to provide, you will be contacted. Act on priority !
3. Keep infrastructure up to date: Ensure operating systems are patched properly!
4. Plan for recovery: No prevention or defense plan is infallible. That’s why a strong business continuity plan for recovery is being defined and will be managed by Lab security specialists. Support the preventive and recovery actions on priority within an acceptable timeframe.

For more information on MN Laboratory Cybersecurity program in SRDT, visit
https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/MNLabCyberSecurity/labsec/Home.aspx

attachments.content_excerpt:
Hallo MN Cloud Core team,
 
I would like to share some feedback from a very interesting meeting, that Rajeev, Ashish and I had with Manoj Modi and his management team in Mumbai. Sorry for this longish mail, but I need to share this.

RJIO wanted to share their strategy and concerns about our responsiveness and lack of flexibility and discuss what they expect from us on their way towards the next 100 mio VoLTE subs. We are a key vendor in their network and crucial for their growth plans, so this was a very important meeting.
 
We knew, that it would be a tough meeting and I joined it on short notice to show our commitment and explain our plans to address their concerns and our plans and strategy towards cloud core. I must say, this was one of the most remarkable meetings, I have had with customers in at least the last 10 years. Really something to learn from and I believe important to share with the full Cloud Core team.
We got some very important messages for our transformation journey that go far beyond this project that we need to focus on.
 
To make it short, they have "grilled" me for 3 1/2 hours and it got very clear that our current way of operation does not work for customers like them. They want to move extremely fast and add another 100 mio subs with an iconic low cost, but high-end services phone. They showed it to us, it looks like a simple feature phone, but has almost everything you would expect from a high end smart phone, incl. voice control (any language!), video, full VoLTE stack, except the form factor that looks like a feature phone. It will be rolled out in volume soon and the network needs to be properly prepared for this. Really impressive.
 
The approach, they are taking is very different from many other customers. They want to disrupt the market with new technologies, outpace competition with an enormous own competence to shape technology to their needs. Speed and flexibility is key for them and they do not understand, why it takes us months and years to solve specific requests.

But there is even more. I am used to get challenged on quality, roadmaps, serviceability, etc., but this time it was on a deep technical level, even down to call flows and architectural details. It got very apparent that the answers we have given them so far, and I have tried to explain them, were not really compelling and they have a hard time to understand, why we are so much struggling with that.
 
Just to mention 2 out of many more examples, they are very frustrated with:

There is a feature called “net-loc feature support” that prevents them from supporting international roaming, which is of course a business-critical service. We gave as answer that this has been standardized just in 3GG R14 and we therefore need some time to implement (Q1 next year). Their response to this was, it is standardized since R13 and they can even tell us exactly what to change to make it work. The person, who raised it, explained he was even part of the standardization and does not see any reason, why this cannot be done very quickly. Right or wrong, we at least haven’t discussed directly with him and left the impression, we do not really understand their need and just looking for excuses to not do it.

The other one was “debug and transaction logs”. This is a topic that is open since more than 1 ½ years and we now promised to deliver in Q1 next year. So far, we did not even specify any date. We all know, that this is a really complex topic, but they claimed, they have got this from each and every product in their network, except our IMS. They do not understand, why the RCAs takes so long and even claimed to it on their own, if we can provide them the respective traces and dumps. They asked us very directly, why we can design a product w/o such basic functionality.

I mention these specific cases not to discuss, if it’s right or wrong or to blame anybody. It just shows, what they really want: get in touch directly with the R&D experts, discuss and solve the issues as we go and we all benefit from the innovation and speed that such a close cooperation would bring. Sounds like truly fast and agile and Devops, right?

I truly believe that these guys are really disrupting our industry. They are extremely ambitious and demanding and we need to work as close with them, as we can. There will be more and more projects and customers like this - e.g. 3UK is moving in the same direction - and the closer we can work with them, the faster we can learn and adapt and differentiate from others, who do not have the same experience.

Any crisis creates also opportunities. We have learned it e.g. from the Verizon case some time ago. It is painful at the beginning, but at the end it really helps and elevates us to the next level. I believe, we should do the same here.

I also believe, we can manage that. They e.g. mentioned, that the R&D support was excellent at the beginning. We have given them dedicated R&D support and attention when the network was build. Once it was up and running, we however moved out and went back to our standard way of working and we ended up in the situation we are in right now. The customer is very frustrated and questioning, if we are the right partner for them to go forward with their ambitious plans. Not good at all.

My learning out of this meeting is, that we need to get back to where we have been: get in direct touch with them, discuss, understand, move quickly and learn and adapt as we go. Reliance JIO is one, if not THE, most disruptive and innovative operator in this industry. They also have a very aggressive plan to go to the cloud. They e.g. claim to have an even bigger cloud infrastructure than ATT by now and they are the fastest growing VoLTE network anyway. Let’s step up here and try a different approach. I am convinced, this way of working is the future: fast, agile, truly cloud based and all of this in a very close contact with the customer.

We simply cannot miss that chance, what do you think?

Cheers,
Michael

references.content_excerpt:
MN QD "Leading SAFe" Training

On Aug-16 & Aug-17, MN QD continues the roll out of "Leading SAFe" trainings. 42 trainees from TAS, MSS&MGW and Het-RAN tribes joined the training. People had a good discussion on SAFe principles, Lean-Agile mindset and configuration of SAFe, etc. All participants also enjoined the simulation of PI planning.

With the SAFe knowledge from the training, each team had a wonderful presentation as a ending of the training to show their analysis and action plan for SAFe implementation in the future. Lets' looking forwarding to their good achievement by SAFe.

cc: Li, Ellen J. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Mai, Maggie (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Shao, Guilan (NSB - CN/Hangzhou), Zhang, Klaus (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Liu, Aaron A. (NSB - CN/Qingdao)

cc: Li, Ellen J. (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Mai, Maggie (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Shao, Guilan (NSB - CN/Hangzhou), Zhang, Klaus (NSB - CN/Qingdao), Liu, Aaron A. (NSB - CN/Qingdao)

references.title: MN Coursera Pilot restarted now
references.content_excerpt:
Dear TC CoDe Managers,
We turn to you today with really good news. MN Coursera Pilot is back and ready to go live again. Be prepared please to address the submisions already made by employees interested in the pilot, but also to further promote it from your TC CoDe level. 👉 MOOCs info page (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/codeformnpcc/stratcomp/moocs/SitePages/Home.aspx)

General rules
The main rule is that one pilot participant can be assigned one token only. Check the attached power point presentation for more details on how to proceed with employees pilot submissions.
The slide deck includes:

- info on how to add employees names into the system
- info on how to add a requested training into the system
- selection of email templates that you can use when contacting pilot participants

Note that employees have access to the following Coursera learning repositories:

http://nok.it/coursera_MN
This link redirects employees to Coursera offfer for MN only which includes only approved catalog: TC + strategic competencies. The training is done here by Pilot participants.

http://nok.it/coursera_all
If employees from your TC wish to find another training offering of their interest, they will be able to look trough this Coursera general catalogue and submit the one they are interested in to be approved and added into the MN catalogue by you. 👉 MOOCs info page (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/codeformnpcc/stratcomp/moocs/SitePages/Home.aspx)
Important information
Bear in mind that the Coursera vouchers are available for a relatively short period, that is till the end of March 2019. Therefore, the sooner you promote the program locally, the bigger chance it will reach your target audience and be continued further into 2019. Note also that employees from Germany and France for the time being cannot join the pilot because of legal restrictions. 👉 MOOCs info page (https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/codeformnpcc/stratcomp/moocs/SitePages/Home.aspx)
Thank you for your attention.
Coursera Pilot Team

cc: Dziemianko, Katarzyna (Nokia - PL/Wroclaw), Cervenca-Lates, Augustin (Nokia - RO/Timisoara)

references.content_excerpt:
姓名：宫本红
部门：研发部
地点：青岛

• 参与的公司组织的CSR活动名称+贡献小时数：

2017年3月26日，“守护海岸线”海洋科研监测活动，贡献约5小时。

2017年5月5日，《我的未来会更好》公益活动，担任主讲老师，贡献约33小时。

2017年6月5日至8日，江西鹰潭电脑公益，担任主讲老师，贡献约104小时。

• 参与的非公司组织的其他CSR活动名称+贡献小时数

创办头马俱乐部公众号‘ALUQingdaoToastmaster'，定期发布俱乐部活动总结，演讲汇总等，累计发布上百篇文章，贡献100小时以上。

担任头马俱乐部财务官，小区比赛评委，贡献100小时以上。

• 公益感言（文字或视频均可）

快乐奉献，快乐成长。感恩公司有大爱，助我开启公益之旅。自2014年第一次参加公司组织的JA活动，担任主讲老师，先后又跟随公司的脚步，分别于2015年，2017年两次参加“电脑再生公益活动_江西站”，担任班级主题活动主讲老师，并参加《我的未来会更好》公益活动，担任主讲老师。每一次公益活动，都有幸结识来自五湖四海的志愿者，还有渴望成长的孩子们，志愿者们的多才多艺，倾情奉献，孩子们的天真烂漫，感动着我，激励着我。公益无处不在，公益从小事做起，公益从身边做起，号召家人与孩子一起参与“守护海岸线”海洋科研监测活动；号召小组同事一起为公司发起社会公益项目捐资捐助；创办公司头马俱乐部公众号‘ALUQingdaoToastmaster'，定期发布俱乐部活动总结，演讲汇总等，累计发布上百篇文章。快乐公益，快乐你我他。

• 公益活动照片和小视频

references.title: Your voice matters! Invitation to participate in the Change Map survey
references.content_excerpt:
Yesterday you have received the invitation to the Change Map survey (https://survey.changetracking.com/survey/nokia/mn-all/cycle-3) via email. The survey results will help us to continue our journey to become an architecture-driven organization.

Please complete this anonymous web-based Change Map questionnaire, it takes only 15 to 20 minutes. All individual responses are strictly confidential and reported to Mobile Networks on squad group/team, tribe and unit level anonymously.

The survey is open till September 7th, please click the following link:
- https://survey.changetracking.com/survey/nokia/mn-all/cycle-3
- Your username is your email address (firstname.lastname@nokia.com (mailto:firstname.lastname@nokia.com) or firstname.lastname@nokia-sbell.com (mailto:firstname.lastname@nokia-sbell.com))

Based on the results, we will be able to respond appropriately to issues and concerns, and develop an action plan for improvement together with you. Your input is important for the successful transformation of Mobile Networks!

Thank you for taking the time to participate in the Change Map survey!
#mnchangemap (https://www.yammer.com/nokia.com/topics/27147201)

cc: Wang, Wilson WW. references.content_excerpt:
Nokia Quality: Lean Six Sigma belt management program update (Aug 2018)

Dear all,

Since its launch in 2012, Nokia Quality’s Lean Six Sigma Belt Certification program has been an integral element to our sustained improvement efforts, delivering financial impact more than 707 mEUR and over 1000 certified belts!

As part of our continuous efforts to improve the program and further accelerate the business impact, we have now simplified the Belt Certification process and streamlined your user experience.
I am pleased to share the following key improvements effective August 15th, 2018:

• Simplified class enrolment - Blue Belt and Green Belt candidates will be able to enrol to classroom training quickly and easily. A simplified project proposal is required to be submitted to Continuous Improvement (CI) project Repository to be able to enrol for a classroom training. No further approvals will be required in addition.

• Simplified Blue Belt & Green Belt certification path in the Learning and Development Hub (LDH) with fewer steps.

• Reduced number of approvals – 30% reduction in the required approvals for Blue Belt/Green Belt certification path. Refer to Nokia Quality Certifications Procedure and updated Blue Belt & Green Belt Project Storyboard Template for details.

• Improved Continuous Improvement Community of Practice (CI CoP) to address key needs for different user groups: candidates, certified belts, mentors and champions.

• Simplified Nokia Quality Certifications Procedure in slide format to easily review nomination and certification requirements for different CI certifications (Orange, Purple, L6S Belt certifications). The previous Lean Six Sigma Certification procedure is now converted to a Work Instruction document for further reference.

I do believe that you will find these changes helpful, and I welcome your feedback to enhance further as needed.

Best regards,
Ashutosh Pandey
Head of Strategic Quality Transformation (SQT)
#livingquality

P.S : After the go-live today, minor changes on the associated tools (CI CoP, QIPP) will continue to be updated till the end of August 2018.
----------
Useful Links:
1. Class enrollment project proposal : https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/cicop/CICOPDocuments/030_Templates/10_Projects_Proposal_Template/
2. CI project repository: https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/PR-Q22018/
3. Nokia Quality Certifications Procedure: https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/cicop/SitePages/Nokia-Quality-Certifications-Procedure.aspx
4. CI Community of Practice: https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/cicop/SitePages/Home.aspx
5. Project Storyboard Templates: https://nokia.sharepoint.com/sites/cicop/SitePages/Projects-Templates-(Storyboard).aspx

cc: Arora, Deepti (Nokia - US/Naperville), Cox, Ian (Nokia - GB/Bristol), Sherwood, Rob (Nokia - US/Naperville), Hebert, Monique (Nokia - US/Naperville), Schroepfer, Scott (Nokia - US/Naperville), Nicosia, John (Nokia - US/Murray Hill), Lhospital, Jj (Nokia - US/Naperville), Tam, Jim (Nokia - CA/Ottawa), Roznovsky, John (Nokia - US/Naperville), Messer, Tilo (Nokia - DE/Munich), Hoover, Clinton (Nokia - US/Irving), Nanda, Vic (Nokia - US/Irving), Samuel Pon, Rajesh (Nokia - SG/Singapore), Karlova, Arina (Nokia - EE/Tallinn)

references.content_excerpt:
I'd like to share a summary of the Customer Engagement Survey (CES) feedback. Starting with the overall Nokia CES - the 12mmw CPV is 56.9% (as of Aug 13th) which compares to Huawei at 62.0% and Ericsson at 53.0%. There is no MN score available, but since MN accounts for most of the Nokia business, the Nokia score is highly aligned to the MN performance. Since high CPV scores are correlated with higher revenues and market share - it is in the best interests of each one of us to take action to improve the Nokia CPV score.

Looking to the customer feedback specific to MN, the attribute with the largest number of comments is Design Quality at 1310 comments in the last 12 months, of which 60.6% are positive. We should be quite proud of this feedback. We must also recognize this performance is not good enough because we receive strong feedback from our leading customers that our current quality performance is insufficient. So let's celebrate the high positivity status and use this as motivation to build even higher quality hardware, software, documentation and solutions.

The second and third most commented attributes are Roadmap Execution (25.6% positive) and Feature Content (46.3% positive). You read that right - both attributes are well below 50% positivity. This feedback also appears as competitive pressures when our leaders talk with customers F2F. Internally, we see the result of these poor scores - manifested as pressure to inject additional features into programs after P2 and I6.

How can we improve our performance in these two attributes, and reduce the late injection of features into programs? Throughout MN, we each play a role in improving our performance. Improvement opportunities exists in feature candidate injection into the feature screening process, reduced prioritization of features never activated, faster and higher quality R&D and Test performance, as well as improved installability. Everyone can take a role in improving our performance.

In MN, we have a CPV champions network - colleagues representing each part of MN, who are leading the analysis and actioning of our current CPV gaps. This network of leaders is led by Delorenzo, Bob (Nokia - US/Irving) - please reach out to him to learn more, to find the colleague representing your unit, and to help improve our results.

cc: Arora, Deepti (Nokia - US/Naperville), Mathew, Siby (Nokia - IN/Bangalore), Rouanne, Marc (Nokia - FR/Paris-Saclay)
